commit_message:
Fix py26 timeouts

tests.benchmark.test_runner.test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test
sometimes produce gate timeouts (worked more then 60 minutes)

Seems like the issues was related to the way we use mock.

Change-Id: I96c79b4d6d321931015413e7a308ddd3d1d83f20
Closes-Bug: #1271831
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/82/72082/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.runner.rutils") @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.utils.osclients") def test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test(self, mock_osclients, mock_utils): mock_osclients.Clients.return_value = fakes.FakeClients() srunner = runner.ScenarioRunner(mock.MagicMock(), self.fake_kw) runner.__openstack_clients__ = ["client"] times = 1 duration = 0.001 active_users = 2 mock_utils.Timer = fakes.FakeTimer results = srunner._run_scenario(fakes.FakeScenario, "something_went_wrong", {}, "continuous", {"times": times, "timeout": 1, "active_users": active_users}) self.assertEqual(len(results), times) for r in results: self.assertEqual(r['time'], 10) self.assertEqual(r['error'][:2], [str(Exception), "Something went wrong"]) results = srunner._run_scenario(fakes.FakeScenario, "something_went_wrong", {}, "continuous", {"duration": duration, "timeout": 1, "active_users": active_users}) self.assertEqual(len(results), active_users) for r in results: self.assertEqual(r['time'], 10) self.assertEqual(r['error'][:2], [str(Exception), "Something went wrong"])
deleted_lines: def test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test(self): with mock.patch("rally.benchmark.utils.osclients") as mock_osclients: mock_osclients.Clients.return_value = fakes.FakeClients() srunner = runner.ScenarioRunner(mock.MagicMock(), self.fake_kw) runner.__openstack_clients__ = ["client"] times = 1 duration = 0.01 active_users = 2 with mock.patch("rally.benchmark.runner.rutils") as mock_utils: mock_utils.Timer = fakes.FakeTimer results = srunner._run_scenario(fakes.FakeScenario, "something_went_wrong", {}, "continuous", {"times": times, "active_users": active_users, "timeout": 1}) self.assertEqual(len(results), times) for r in results: self.assertEqual(r['time'], 10) self.assertEqual(r['error'][:2], [str(Exception), "Something went wrong"]) results = srunner._run_scenario(fakes.FakeScenario, "something_went_wrong", {}, "continuous", {"duration": duration, "active_users": active_users, "timeout": 1}) self.assertEqual(len(results), active_users) for r in results: self.assertEqual(r['time'], 10) self.assertEqual(r['error'][:2], [str(Exception), "Something went wrong"])

commit_message:
Make neutron tempest run with tenant isolation by default

This commit removes the workaround that switched tempest tenant isolation
to false if Neutron was enabled. Recent changes to both neutron and tempest
should make this safe finally.

Change-Id: I929fcc73a7ef9a10f01af422ff62f9d451d52ae3

commit_message:
remove database init from horizon

horizon default config no longer uses a session database, it uses
signed cookies instead, so we can stop doing db initialization and
cleanup (which based on errexit we weren't doing correctly anyway).

Change-Id: Icae4318e2784486db2888cbf353e95ac9a5d7cba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/95/71995/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

change in is_service_enabled().

commit_message:
Fix config group for cinder multi_backend

This commit just updates the config group for the multi_backend option.
Tempest change d5c9602b created a volume-feature-enabled group and moved this
volume there but devstack was never updated with the change.

Closes-Bug: #1276326

Change-Id: Icf2e96783feec4edbd4d477f8492651cd9bb3f01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/99/71099/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG volume multi_backend_enabled "True"

Do not cache not connected ssh client

Do not cache paramiko.client if the connection fails.

Change-Id: I6105167f2221d45a88b6b37265e9bb6daf427c63
Fixes: bug 1277845

commit_message:
Don't initalise deployment engine when starting a task

In some cases initialsing the deployment engine can lead to
authentication against external services - eg openstack server provider.
This is unnecessary when the deployment is already complete.

Change-Id: Ibe06a6acf8396023059292a9e5804616ed28e766
Closes-Bug: #1277342

commit_message:
Don't require glance to use OpenStack server provider

Currently the openstack server provider fails if glance is not present
in the service catalog, even if the user only wishes to use pre-existing
images.

This is a problem when using certain *cough* cloud providers that don't
expose glance.

Change-Id: Ib91be7e9396190045d82c3f0a059c92a73374499
Closes-Bug: #1277150

commit_message:
Fixed issue with description of Murano OSTF tests.

Fixed description of preparation for Platform OSTF tests for Murano.

Added information about new OSTF tests and removed information
about two incorrect Murano OSTF tests with Server Farms deployment.

Change-Id: Ib36c54602b6d28313afb861495763e9857c39140
Closes-Bug: #1271952

commit_message:
Replace mongo shell interaction with script

In the section of 'Install the Telemetry service', we need to create
the database and a ceilometer database user. Currently we use mongo
shell and require user to interact with it. However, we can use
mongo script and do it via single copy and paste.

Change-Id: I6b88f920c9576aabdc190affc807a0f566ee4c5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/34/71734/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>mongo --host <replaceable>controller</replaceable> --eval ' db = db.getSiblingDB("ceilometer"); db.addUser({user: "ceilometer", pwd: "<replaceable>CEILOMETER_DBPASS</replaceable>", roles: [ "readWrite", "dbAdmin" ]})'</userinput></screen>
deleted_lines: <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>mongo --host <replaceable>controller</replaceable></userinput> <prompt>></prompt> <userinput>use ceilometer</userinput> <prompt>></prompt> <userinput>db.addUser( { user: "ceilometer", pwd: "<replaceable>CEILOMETER_DBPASS</replaceable>", roles: [ "readWrite", "dbAdmin" ] } )</userinput></screen>

commit_message:
Enable py33 unit test

Python 3.3 unit test cannot be run because renamed modules and
attributes compatibility problem, this patch uses six module to
enable python 3.3 unit test. All failures can be fixed in next
patches.

Change-Id: I346997d295b0e5cae6fe9beda21573cebed3d44a
Implements: blueprint swiftclient-py33-support

commit_message:
Modify the backtrace of invalid token

The backtrace message 'Token authorization failed' is not meaning
clearly.

Change-Id: Iaad2b955cef6be7319e4d92af8ba06098e8e047e
Closes-Bug:#1164452

commit_message:
Use six.moves for urllib imports

Several urlparse, urlunparse, and quote usages were updated to use
six.moves.urllib.parse in order to work across Python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I156e62b01f5fbe3725355353ed62c64a48116b50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/22/48322/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves import http_client, urllib return urllib.parse.quote(value, safe) parsed = urllib.parse.urlparse(url) proxy_parsed = urllib.parse.urlparse(proxy) if proxy else None parsed = list(urllib.parse.urlparse(url)) url = urllib.parse.urlunparse(parsed)
deleted_lines: from urllib import quote as _quote from urlparse import urlparse, urlunparsefrom six.moves import http_client return _quote(value, safe) parsed = urlparse(url) proxy_parsed = urlparse(proxy) if proxy else None parsed = list(urlparse(url)) url = urlunparse(parsed)

commit_message:
Allow to have noqa on H202

`self.assertRaises(Exception)` is not allowed per H202. But in certain
contexts, there can be a lot of different exception that can be raised
without that being a problem (KeyError, ValueError…) nor a bug, so
having the ability to noqa it is useful.

Change-Id: If4bc560edf2cbc982b45b32be20aebced3e4a586

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-27 14:17:56.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/dfb71d5082c2e02c700842347e71e6e9b63a81d1', 'message': 'tempest concurrency 3

Tempest was used with concurrency 4 for a long time,
at the end of havana cycle concurrency 8 was considered to use,
but it just decreased the job time by several minute.

After the concurrency decreased from 4 to 2 the jobs run time increased
5-15 minute.

Setting the concurrency to 3 in order to decrease the run time, but

Change-Id: I07c96b89c3fed788012c801f8c538b3f8741b6c4
'}]
commit_message:
tempest concurrency 3

Tempest was used with concurrency 4 for a long time,
at the end of havana cycle concurrency 8 was considered to use,
but it just decreased the job time by several minute.

After the concurrency decreased from 4 to 2 the jobs run time increased
5-15 minute.

Setting the concurrency to 3 in order to decrease the run time, but
do not give as stress to the vms as with 4.

Change-Id: I07c96b89c3fed788012c801f8c538b3f8741b6c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/70/69370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY=${TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY:-3}
deleted_lines: export TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY=${TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY:-2}

commit_message:
Variable for launching tempests baremetal scenario

Variable $DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_OPS allows to
launch baremetal basic ops scenario. There are other pull
requests into tempest and into devstack which are connected
with this change.

commit_message:
Celery plugging

Celery application were included to project. Code that launches workers
in separate subprocess when server is started was added. Workers are
terminated by server shutdown.

Celeryconfig file was created with all needed settings params for celery.

In ostf_celery_app.py script celery task definition which describes test
run execution was added and cleaning_up. These tasks are now assynchoniously
called via NoseAdapter's methods. WSGI-controllers and models script
were modified to provide proper starting of tests execution.

To make row execution of dependent test runs chain pattern from celery
is using now. Also maxtasksperchild param was added to workers setup command
in order to remove issue with dependent test runs data.

Working code for kill action was added. Now when test runs are started in run
method of NoseAdapter task_registry dict stores binding between celery
task and test_run being executed by this task. This bindind
is used then in kill method for task termination and db data updating.

Change-Id: I5e614b2b2df102be432c18a9a0350bb11d7d98aa

added_lines: # Copyright 2013 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import celery import logging import celeryconfig from fuel_plugin.ostf_adapter.storage import engine, models from fuel_plugin.ostf_adapter.nose_plugin import nose_storage_plugin from fuel_plugin.ostf_adapter.nose_plugin import nose_test_runner LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) APP = celery.Celery('ostf_celery_app', broker='amqp://ostf:ostf@localhost/ostf') APP.config_from_object(celeryconfig) @APP.task def run_test_task(test_run_id, cluster_id, nailgun_credentials, argv_add): '''Starts testrun via custom nose plugin ''' session = engine.get_session() try: nose_test_runner.SilentTestProgram( addplugins=[nose_storage_plugin.StoragePlugin( test_run_id, str(cluster_id), nailgun_credentials)], exit=False, argv=['ostf_tests'] + argv_add) except Exception: LOG.exception('Test run ID: %s', test_run_id) finally: models.TestRun.update_test_run( session, test_run_id, status='finished')

commit_message:
Make --bypass-url default to env[BYPASS_URL]

This helps everyone avoid providing --bypass-url every time they are
using a proxy.

Change-Id: I9f14aa146807fcd53f4a6ad58a595e89fd82322b

commit_message:
All API controllers inherit from wsgi.Controller

Most of the Nova Public API Controllers inherit from wsgi.Controller, but
still some Nova Public APIs controllers directly inherit from object. So
it's necessary to unify all the Nova Public API Controllers inherit from
wsgi.Controller.

Change-Id: Ib332fb7b1051589f38463af4959383c606017637
Closes-Bug: #1262480

commit_message:
Improve staticweb work with transformed URLs

Staticweb redirections not worked properly if requested URL
was transformed by cname_lookup and domain_remap middlewares.
Location of redirection didn't preserve requested domain
(replaced by storage_domain) and wasn't properly handle by staticweb.

Add some enviromental variables that make staticweb aware
about other middlewares actions. Domain_remap join trailing slash
in path when staticweb required it.

Change-Id: If53d41feb1f01505f68b72114b4abbf2ac4c3673
Fixes: bug #1190625

commit_message:
Fix minor text spacing issue in Heat CLI usage menu

This just fixes a small spacing issue with the Heat CLI
usage menu where there was no spacing between the end
of a word and a quoted word and various other minor
changes. Purely cosmetic.

Change-Id: If051b932589db663b6f066dea537ee80bfb4ebb5

added_lines: # fuelweb_admin is always on eth0 interfaces_dict['eth0'] = interfaces_dict.get('eth0', []) interfaces_dict['eth0'].append('fuelweb_admin') interfaces = self.client.get_node_interfaces(node_id) all_networks = dict() for interface in interfaces: all_networks.update( {net['name']: net for net in interface['assigned_networks']}) for interface in interfaces: name = interface["name"] interface['assigned_networks'] = \ [all_networks[i] for i in interfaces_dict.get(name, [])]
deleted_lines: interfaces = self.client.get_node_interfaces(node_id) for interface in interfaces: interface_name = interface['name'] interface['assigned_networks'] = [] for allowed_network in interface['allowed_networks']: key_exists = interface_name in interfaces_dict if key_exists and \ allowed_network['name'] in interfaces_dict[interface_name]: interface['assigned_networks'].append(allowed_network) if allowed_network['name'] == "fuelweb_admin": interface['assigned_networks'].append(allowed_network)

commit_message:
Brick fix BrickException message formatting

This patch fixes an issue when passing in a
formatting key and value for formatted
text messages for all Brick exceptions.

Added unit tests for brick's exception

Change-Id: I76dcfc6872ca20305d1844162dd0ae28c4bb565c
Related-Bug: 1238085

deleted_lines: import sys msg_fmt = _("An unknown exception occurred.") message = self.msg_fmt % kwargs exc_info = sys.exc_info() % self.msg_fmt) message = self.msg_fmt

commit_message:
Wrong hint key in volume create function

Hint key has to be 'OS-SCH-HNT:scheduler_hints' not 'scheduler_hints'
and scheduler_hints key has to be located in same level with volume.

Closes-Bug: #1276088

Change-Id: I3f0affab569bf89db4ad03c039aaa7e702546e2f

commit_message:
validate if the router has external gateway interface set

If the router wants to work with vpn service, we must
make sure external gateway interface is set.

This patch cannot prevent user from clearing the gateway interface
of the router after the vpnservice is created.

Change-Id: If0f00def949b31c1e3da7a2cd055454567201e4c
Closes-Bug: #1258379

subject: Remove host from per notification options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-03 08:13:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/5a9fa42012000fbdd1e6d6bca8de966a0da4efb4', 'message': "Remove host from per notification options

In oslo.messaging publisher_id is expected to be set in a one of.
Specifying host allows you to set the sender so that messages come from
'identity.host' however this is something you are far more likely to
want to set up per instance that modify when actually emitting a
notification. As there is nothing so far using this parameter
remove it.

Change-Id: Ie70c313bcebd67cc8c6a3d25eba95405089bd44a
blueprint: oslo-messaging
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-04 02:51:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/e176d828c2a9fed7e15bd194f9da7ff8482e0cd0', 'message': "Remove host from per notification options

Specifying host allows you to set the sender so that messages come from
'identity.%(host)s' however this is something you are far more likely to
want to set up per keystone instance than modify when actually emitting
a notification.

It is also incompatible with the way oslo.messaging expects to be called
where you setup a publisher_id once at startup and then all future
messages will reuse this value.

As there is nothing so far using this parameter remove it.

Change-Id: Ie70c313bcebd67cc8c6a3d25eba95405089bd44a
blueprint: oslo-messaging
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-04 02:51:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/a301da62ebfad37b1ed016255cdfc1f596a5e170', 'message': "Remove host from per notification options

Specifying host allows you to set the sender so that messages come from
'identity.%(host)s' however this is something you are far more likely to
want to set up per keystone instance than modify when actually emitting
a notification.

It is also incompatible with the way oslo.messaging expects to be called
where you setup a publisher_id once at startup and then all future
messages will reuse this value.

commit_message:
Remove host from per notification options

Specifying host allows you to set the sender so that messages come from
'identity.%(host)s' however this is something you are far more likely to
want to set up per keystone instance than modify when actually emitting
a notification.

It is also incompatible with the way oslo.messaging expects to be called
where you setup a publisher_id once at startup and then all future
messages will reuse this value.

As there is nothing so far using this parameter remove it.

Change-Id: Ie70c313bcebd67cc8c6a3d25eba95405089bd44a
blueprint: oslo-messaging

deleted_lines: :param host: host of the resource (optional) def __init__(self, operation, resource_type, host=None): self.host = host args[1], # f(self, resource_id, ...) self.host)def _send_notification(operation, resource_type, resource_id, host=None): :param host: resource host publisher_id = notifier_api.publisher_id(service, host=host)

commit_message:
clean up keystone-manage man page

- wrap literals with double backticks so things render in RST
- replace triple line breaks with double line breaks for consistency
- replace 'REST api' with 'HTTP API' because 2x pedantic

Change-Id: Ib28d0cea06f81b32ef985dfa74333693ef32ae46
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/64/71164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ``keystone-manage`` is the command line tool which interacts with the Keystone service to initialize and update data within Keystone. Generally, ``keystone-manage`` is only used for operations that cannot be accomplished with the HTTP API, such data import/export and database migrations.Invoking ``keystone-manage`` by itself will give you some usage information.
deleted_lines: keystone-manage is the command line tool that interacts with the Keystone service to initialize and update data within Keystone. Generally, keystone-manage is only used for operations that cannot be accomplished with the Keystone REST api, such data import/export and schema migrations. Invoking keystone-manage by itself will give you some usage information.

commit_message:
rename templated.TemplatedCatalog to templated.Catalog

This addresses a long standing TODO for consistency across catalog
drivers, making it more intuitive to switch drivers.

UpgradeImpact

commit_message:
Adding additional datastore tests

This adds 4 more datastore types and versions tests.

Change-Id: I4da3721a764d76e1bd625da69fdef3976edb64d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/96/70296/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test def test_datastore_get_by_uuid(self): datastore = self.rd_client.datastores.get( test_config.dbaas_datastore_id) with TypeCheck('Datastore', datastore) as check: check.has_field("id", basestring) check.has_field("name", basestring) check.has_field("links", list) assert_equal(datastore.id, test_config.dbaas_datastore_id) @test def test_datastore_version_list_by_uuid(self): versions = self.rd_client.datastore_versions.list( test_config.dbaas_datastore_id) for version in versions: with TypeCheck('DatastoreVersion', version) as check: check.has_field("id", basestring) check.has_field("name", basestring) check.has_field("links", list) @test def test_datastore_version_get_by_uuid(self): version = self.rd_client.datastore_versions.get( test_config.dbaas_datastore_id, test_config.dbaas_datastore_version) with TypeCheck('DatastoreVersion', version) as check: check.has_field("id", basestring) check.has_field("name", basestring) check.has_field("datastore", basestring) check.has_field("links", list) assert_equal(version.name, test_config.dbaas_datastore_version) @test def test_datastore_version_invalid_uuid(self): try: version = self.rd_client.datastore_versions.get_by_uuid( test_config.dbaas_datastore_version) except exceptions.BadRequest as e: assert_equal(e.message, "Datastore version '%s' cannot be found." % test_config.dbaas_datastore_version)

commit_message:
Brick connector fix for GlusterFS

Fixes an InvalidParameterValue error by passing the required
information to Brick for mounting.

See also: 1cd3626 Brick connector revised fix for NFS

Bump driver version 1.1.1.

Closes-Bug: 1238085

Change-Id: Ie45889460dd4775a556d592161c98c24a56989c7

added_lines: from cinder.brick.remotefs import remotefsfrom cinder.openstack.common import processutils def __init__(self, execute=processutils.execute, *args, **kwargs): self._remotefsclient = None self.base = getattr(self.configuration, 'glusterfs_mount_point_base', CONF.glusterfs_mount_point_base) self._remotefsclient = remotefs.RemoteFsClient( 'glusterfs', execute, glusterfs_mount_point_base=self.base) def set_execute(self, execute): super(GlusterfsDriver, self).set_execute(execute) if self._remotefsclient: self._remotefsclient.set_execute(execute) 'data': data, 'mount_point_base': self._get_mount_point_base() return self._remotefsclient.get_mount_point(glusterfs_share) def _get_mount_point_base(self): return self.base
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): 'data': data return os.path.join(self.configuration.glusterfs_mount_point_base, self._get_hash_str(glusterfs_share))

commit_message:
New Event uuid column and autoincremental id

Re added the autoincremental id column for the Event table, and added a
new column to store the event uuid. The uuid will be exposed to the user
as the id of the event, but internally the event will be handled using
the value of the id column.

Change-Id: I43464c6079bf7631fda0c4ab112b8f874c6190a3
Co-Authored-By: chmouel@enovance.com
Closes-Bug: #1261883
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/39/63839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: id = sqlalchemy.Column(sqlalchemy.Integer, primary_key=True) uuid = sqlalchemy.Column(sqlalchemy.String(length=36), default=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))
deleted_lines: id = sqlalchemy.Column(sqlalchemy.String(36), primary_key=True, default=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))

commit_message:
RBD unit test improvements

This commit brings the implementation of the test_rbd and
test_backup_ceph unit tests more inline and tries to ensure
that no mock is set without being unset so as not to tread
on the toes of any other tests.

Change-Id: Ibb6bd3bf90952914512e3fa39fd216f43f0f8ecb
Closes-bug: 1276657
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/26/71326/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change-Id: Ic5d1df60eb3b86696f4c61d609e617c2ed05518c
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new dependency: trollius

Trollius is a port of the new asyncio module on Python 2.6 and 2.7. I would
like to replace eventlet with asyncio (Trollius). See my blueprint for Oslo
Messaging for more information:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/blueprints/asyncio

Limit the version to < 0.2 because the API *might* be broken in version 0.2.

Change-Id: Ic5d1df60eb3b86696f4c61d609e617c2ed05518c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/83/70983/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

trouble by updating instances or backups with out-of-date information.

commit_message:
Ignore outdated messages sent to conductor

Adds a sent_at field to conductor messages in the manager so that
messages that get out of sync on their way to conductor don't cause
trouble by updating instances or backups with out-of-date information.

Implements: blueprint conductor-ignore-old-messages
Change-Id: If06d2f9c9f993100be66f71274240a59b05b66e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/11/67611/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import datetimefrom trove.openstack.common import timeutils # --- Tests for discarding old messages --- def _add_time(self, last_up, seconds=0): return timeutils.strtime(last_up + datetime.timedelta(seconds=seconds)) def test_heartbeat_newer_timestamp_accepted(self): payload = {'service_status': 'building'} iss_id = self._create_iss() iss = self._get_iss(iss_id) future = self._add_time(iss.updated_at, 60) self.cond_mgr.heartbeat(None, self.instance_id, payload, sent_at=future) iss = self._get_iss(iss_id) self.assertEqual(t_instance.ServiceStatuses.BUILDING, iss.status) def test_heartbeat_older_timestamp_discarded(self): payload = {'service_status': 'building'} iss_id = self._create_iss() iss = self._get_iss(iss_id) past = self._add_time(iss.updated_at, -60) self.cond_mgr.heartbeat(None, self.instance_id, payload, sent_at=past) iss = self._get_iss(iss_id) self.assertEqual(t_instance.ServiceStatuses.NEW, iss.status) def test_backup_newer_timestamp_accepted(self): old_name = "oldname" new_name = "renamed" bkup_id = self._create_backup(old_name) bkup = self._get_backup(bkup_id) future = self._add_time(bkup.updated, 60) self.cond_mgr.update_backup(None, self.instance_id, bkup_id, sent_at=future, name=new_name) bkup = self._get_backup(bkup_id) self.assertEqual(new_name, bkup.name) def test_backup_older_timestamp_discarded(self): old_name = "oldname" new_name = "renamed" bkup_id = self._create_backup(old_name) bkup = self._get_backup(bkup_id) past = self._add_time(bkup.updated, -60) self.cond_mgr.update_backup(None, self.instance_id, bkup_id, sent_at=past, name=new_name) bkup = self._get_backup(bkup_id) self.assertEqual(old_name, bkup.name)

commit_message:
Fix typo in device name

The previous section discusses /dev/drbd0 and this section
uses /dev/drbd1. Rename the second occurence to /dev/drbd0.

Change-Id: I6d30fdcc308a6655a7ce570a68a07cfce091c71e
Closes-Bug: #1276423
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/21/71321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mkfs -t xfs /dev/drbd0
deleted_lines: mkfs -t xfs /dev/drbd1

commit_message:
Adds RDP console support

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-rdp-console

Nova currently supports VNC and SPICE remote console protocols. This
commit adds support for the RDP protocol in a similar way.

Change-Id: I2c219d4a200122c6d6cfcbd8e074dca0f6fea598
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/02/43502/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_rdp_console(self, context, instance, console_type): """Get a url to an instance Console.""" connect_info = self.compute_rpcapi.get_rdp_console(context, instance=instance, console_type=console_type) self.consoleauth_rpcapi.authorize_console(context, connect_info['token'], console_type, connect_info['host'], connect_info['port'], connect_info['internal_access_path'], instance['uuid']) return {'url': connect_info['access_url']} @check_instance_host def get_rdp_connect_info(self, context, instance, console_type): """Used in a child cell to get console info.""" connect_info = self.compute_rpcapi.get_rdp_console(context, instance=instance, console_type=console_type) return connect_info @wrap_check_policy @check_instance_host

commit_message:
Make test_show_host_detail work with multi host installation

Get the host detail only if the host is compute host
and run the tests for all the compute host not just
for the first one.

Closes-Bug: #1230000

Change-Id: I1830e6071c09d1e751048d74bd828d0eeac282f8
(cherry-picked from 699183617eb99449ae778fdd35475d551ab68b15)

added_lines: hosts = [host for host in hosts if host['service'] == 'compute'] self.assertTrue(len(hosts) >= 1) for host in hosts: hostname = host['host_name'] resp, resources = self.client.show_host_detail(hostname) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertTrue(len(resources) >= 1) host_resource = resources[0]['resource'] self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource) self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource['cpu']) self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource['disk_gb']) self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource['memory_mb']) self.assertIsNotNone(host_resource['project']) self.assertEqual(hostname, host_resource['host'])

Add the keyword "Test" to some test class names

Most test class names contain "Test" and that shows their meanings
clearly. This patch adds the keyword to some test classes which do
not contain it.

commit_message:
cleaned up extension development docs

- added a copyright header
- applied the same order of titles/headers used in other docs (typically
  === underline+overline for top level, === underline for second level,
  --- underline for third level, ~~~ underline for fourth level, etc)
- used ``double backticks`` around literals
- removed excessive whitespace
- replaced a plaintext link with an embedded link

Change-Id: Ic2bf8ed65433c82d0bdfb8dc2d8a18a0b62d6c30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/42/66642/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Keystone Extensions Development Guide ===================================== General ------- This Extension Development Guide provides some mocked code to use as an Extension code base in the `keystone/contrib/example` folder. - All Extensions must be created in the `keystone/contrib` folder. - The new Extension code must be contained in a new folder under `contrib`. - Whenever possible an Extension should follow the following structure convention: keystone \\\ contrib \\\ my_extension \\\ backends (optional) \\\ migrate_repo (optional) \\\ __init__.py (mandatory) \\\ configuration.rst (mandatory) \\\ core.py (mandatory) \\\ controllers.py (mandatory for API Extension) \\\ routers.py (mandatory for API Extension) - If the Extension implements an API Extension the `controllers.py` and `routers.py` must be present and correctly handle the API Extension requests and responses. - If the Extension implements backends a `backends` folder should exist. Backends are defined to store data persistently and can use a variety of technologies. Please see the Backends section in this document for more info. - If the Extension adds data structures a `migrate_repo` folder should exist. - If configuration changes are required/introduced in the `keystone.conf.sample` file, these should be kept disabled as default and have their own element. - If configuration changes are required/introduced in the `keystone-paste.ini`, the new filter must be declared. `keystone.conf.sample` File --------------------------- In the case an Extension needs to change the `keystone.conf.sample` file, it must follow the config file conventions and introduce a dedicated entry. Example:: [example] driver = keystone.contrib.example.backends.sql.mySQLClass [myOtherExtension] extension_flag = False The Extension parameters expressed should be commented out since, by default, extensions are disabled. Example:: [example] #driver = keystone.contrib.example.backends.sql.mySQLClass [myOtherExtension] #extension_flag = False In case the Extension is overriding or re-implementing an existing portion of Keystone the required change should be commented in the `configuration.rst` but not placed in the `keystone.conf.sample` file to avoid unecessary confusion. `keystone-paste.ini` File -------------------------- In the case an Extension is augmenting a pipeline introducing a new `filter` and/or APIs in the `OS` namespace, a corresponding `filter:` section is necessary to be introduced in the `keystone-paste.ini` file. The Extension should declare the filter factory constructor in the `ini` file. Example:: [filter:example] paste.filter_factory = keystone.contrib.example.routers:ExampleRouter. factory The `filter` must not be placed in the `pipeline` and treated as optional. How to add the extension in the pipeline should be specified in detail in the `configuration.rst` file. Package Constructor File ------------------------ The `__init__.py` file represents the package constructor. Extension needs to import what is necessary from the `core.py` module. Example: .. code:: python from keystone.contrib.example.core import * Core ---- The `core.py` file represents the main module defining the data structure and interface. In the `Model View Control` (MVC) model it represents the `Model` part and it delegates to the `Backends` the data layer implementation. In case the `core.py` file contains a `Manager` and a `Driver` it must provide the dependency injections for the `Controllers` and/or other modules using the `Manager`. A good practice is to call the dependency `extension_name_api`. Example: .. code:: python @dependency.provider('example_api') class Manager(manager.Manager): Routers ------- `routers.py` have the objective of routing the HTTP requests and direct them to the right method within the `Controllers`. Extension routers are extending the `wsgi.ExtensionRouter`. Example: .. code:: python from keystone.common import wsgi from keystone.contrib.example import controllers class ExampleRouter(wsgi.ExtensionRouter): PATH_PREFIX = '/OS-EXAMPLE' def add_routes(self, mapper): example_controller = controllers.ExampleV3Controller() mapper.connect(self.PATH_PREFIX + '/example', controller=example_controller, action='do_something', conditions=dict(method=['GET'])) ... Controllers ----------- `controllers.py` have the objective of handing requests and implement the Extension logic. Controllers are consumers of 'Managers' API and must have all the dependency injections required. `Controllers` are extending the `V3Controller` class. Example: .. code:: python @dependency.requires('identity_api', 'example_api') class ExampleV3Controller(controller.V3Controller): ... Backends -------- The `backends` folder provides the model implementations for the different backends supported by the Extension. The folder structure must be the following: keystone \\\ contrib \\\ my_extension \\\ backends \\\ __init__.py (required) \\\ sql.py (optional) \\\ kvs.py (optional) If a SQL backend is provided, in the `sql.py` backend implementation it is mandatory to define the new table(s) that the Extension introduces and the attributes they are composed of. For more information on Backends please consult the Keystone Architecture documentation: (http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/architecture.html) Example: .. code:: python class ExampleSQLBackend(sql.ModelBase, sql.DictBase): """example table description.""" __tablename__ = 'example_table' attributes = ['id', 'type', 'extra'] example_id = sql.Column(sql.String(64), primary_key=True, nullable=False) ... Migrate Repository ------------------ In case the Extension is adding data structures, these must be stored in separate tables and must not be included in the `migrate_repo` of the core Keystone. Please refere to the 'migrate.cfg' file to configure the Extension repository. In order to create the Extension tables and its attributes, a db_sync command must be executed. Example:: ./bin/keystone-manage db_sync --extension example

commit_message:
Change import of exceptions for keystoneclient

Keystoneclients uses module `keystoneclient.exceptions` for storing
exceptions, so it needed to import `keystoneclient.exceptions`
instead of `keystoneclient.apiclient.exceptions` in tempest.

Change-Id: I68cb50bd092e9cc304710bf7748a1c0de5554612
Closes-Bug: #1276093

deleted_lines: import keystoneclient.apiclient.exceptions except keystoneclient.apiclient.exceptions.Conflict:

commit_message:
HOT templates get_param allows extra attributes

HOT templates now allow the use of extra attributes for the
get_param function. With this change it is possible to traverse complex
parameters.

If one of the extra arguments does not match with a key or a valid
index, an empty string is returned.

Change-Id: I49f46b164fd21f6cc7dcea8d4ec1046f6cc912b3
Implements: blueprint hot-select

commit_message:
Make test mysql connection code less confusing

There are two similar methods used for connecting to MySQL apps, but
their arguments differed in order which made for some confusion. This
makes their argument signatures identical.

Change-Id: I48818e2eadb81944e7369e12d09af9c3394d6b57

commit_message:
keystone crontab PATH needs /usr/local/bin

In the cleanup script we call os-apply-config which is likely installed
in /usr/local/bin.

Change-Id: Ie3b54738cac66322050834ae918400e26c6238b7

added_lines: def test_creating_secret_normalize_content_type_text_plain_trailing_space(self): self.secret_req = {'name': self.name, 'payload_content_type': 'text/plain ', 'algorithm': self.secret_algorithm, 'bit_length': self.secret_bit_length, 'mode': self.secret_mode, 'payload': self.payload} self.stream.read.return_value = json.dumps(self.secret_req) self.resource.on_post(self.req, self.resp, self.keystone_id) self.assertEquals(self.resp.status, falcon.HTTP_201) self.secret_req = {'name': self.name, 'payload_content_type': ' text/plain', 'algorithm': self.secret_algorithm, 'bit_length': self.secret_bit_length, 'mode': self.secret_mode, 'payload': self.payload} self.stream.read.return_value = json.dumps(self.secret_req) self.resource.on_post(self.req, self.resp, self.keystone_id) self.assertEquals(self.resp.status, falcon.HTTP_201) def test_creating_secret_normalize_content_type_text_plain_space_charset_utf8_trailing_spaces(self): self.secret_req = {'name': self.name, 'payload_content_type': 'text/plain; charset=utf-8 ', 'algorithm': self.secret_algorithm, 'bit_length': self.secret_bit_length, 'mode': self.secret_mode, 'payload': self.payload} self.stream.read.return_value = json.dumps(self.secret_req) self.resource.on_post(self.req, self.resp, self.keystone_id) self.assertEquals(self.resp.status, falcon.HTTP_201) self.secret_req = {'name': self.name, 'payload_content_type': ' text/plain; charset=utf-8', 'algorithm': self.secret_algorithm, 'bit_length': self.secret_bit_length, 'mode': self.secret_mode, 'payload': self.payload} self.stream.read.return_value = json.dumps(self.secret_req) self.resource.on_post(self.req, self.resp, self.keystone_id) self.assertEquals(self.resp.status, falcon.HTTP_201)

subject: Implement domain specific Identity backends
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-31 17:20:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/3b6d1224968ede7b6c801b7c4fe1a7001164d743', 'message': 'Implement domain specific Identity backends

A common scenario in shared clouds will be that a cloud provider will
want to be able to offer larged customers the ability to interface to
the chosen identity provider. In the base case, this might well be
their one corporate LDAP/AD directory.  A cloud provider might also
want for smaller customers to have their identity managed solely
within the OpenStack cloud, perhaps in an SQL database.

This patch allows domain specifc backends for the identity objects
(namely User and groups). One advantage is that it clear separates
the backends into those that are domain-aware and those that are not,
allowing removal of domain validation from the LDAP backend, for example.

This is a very early WIP version to get feedback on the approach, and is
not expceted to pass the unit tests.  Work still to do:

- Add in missing calls in the Manager for pre/post processing
- Fix up various TODOs
- Write a lot of tests

Implements bp multiple-ldap-servers

Change-Id: I489e8e50035f88eca4235908ae8b1a532645daab

This patch allows domain specifc backends for the identity objects
(namely User and groups). One advantage is that it clear separates
the backends into those that are domain-aware and those that are not,
allowing removal of domain validation from the LDAP backend, for example.

Work still to do:

- Fix up various TODOs
- Write more tests

Implements bp multiple-ldap-servers

Change-Id: I489e8e50035f88eca4235908ae8b1a532645daab

commit_message:
Implement domain specific Identity backends

A common scenario in shared clouds will be that a cloud provider will
want to be able to offer larger customers the ability to interface to
their chosen identity provider. In the base case, this might well be
their own corporate LDAP/AD directory.  A cloud provider might also
want smaller customers to have their identity managed solely
within the OpenStack cloud, perhaps in a shared SQL database.

This patch allows domain specific backends for identity objects
(namely user and groups), which are specified by creation of a domain
configuration file for each domain that requires its own backend.

A side benefit of this change is that it clearly separates the
backends into those that are domain-aware and those that are not,
allowing, for example, the removal of domain validation from the
LDAP identity backend.

Implements bp multiple-ldap-servers

DocImpact

Change-Id: I489e8e50035f88eca4235908ae8b1a532645daab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/30/39530/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, conf=None): if conf is None: conf = CONF self.user = UserApi(conf) self.group = GroupApi(conf) def is_domain_aware(self): return False return identity.filter_user(user_ref) return identity.filter_user(self._get_user(user_id)) return self.user.get_all() # domain_id will already have been handled in the Manager layer, # parameter left in so this matches the Driver specification return identity.filter_user(self.user.get_by_name(user_name)) return identity.filter_user(user_ref) return self.user.get_filtered(user_id)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self): self.user = UserApi(CONF) self.group = GroupApi(CONF) return self.assignment_api._set_default_domain( identity.filter_user(user_ref)) ref = identity.filter_user(self._get_user(user_id)) return self.assignment_api._set_default_domain(ref) return self.assignment_api._set_default_domain(self.user.get_all()) self.assignment_api._validate_default_domain_id(domain_id) ref = identity.filter_user(self.user.get_by_name(user_name)) return self.assignment_api._set_default_domain(ref) user = self.assignment_api._validate_default_domain(user) return (self.assignment_api._set_default_domain (identity.filter_user(user_ref))) user = self.assignment_api._validate_default_domain(user) return (self.assignment_api._set_default_domain (self.user.get_filtered(user_id)))

commit_message:
WIP: Centralized context class for holding "global" data

Many pieces of data, such as user session information, will need to be
accessed from many modules within Solum.  Tenant/project ID is a good example
of some typical data that may reside in this class.  This class is meant to
be the centralized data repository.  Nova was used as a starting point:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/context.pyw

* Added key searches in get(), get_pub() and get_priv() functions

Change-Id: I6a10e3cad26a88f83000d1d3b03b99ba014e3dcb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/01/63201/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 - Rackspace # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ The RequestContext class will hold any persistent data needed throughout a session. Nova was used as a starting point: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/context.py Disclaimers: This code... * Hasn't be created/tested for thread safety * Doesn't currently use thread local storage * Doesn't have docstrings * Haven't found a good portable way to zero out private data memory yet * No internationalization has been implemented yet * Is still in progress... this is meant to initiate discussion Usage example: import context cont = context.RequestContext() cont.set(ip_addr="1.2.3.4") cont.set(user_id=12345) cont.set(private="confidential exception data") cont.set(private={"blah": "blerg", "hello": "world"}) print cont.get() Example output (in user friendly format): { 'ip_addr': '1.2.3.4', 'user_id': 12345, 'private': [ 'confidential exception data', { 'blah': 'blerg', 'hello': 'world' } ] } Private/confidential data is isolated and should be relatively easy to send to logs with this isolation in tact for log filtering on the back end. """ class RequestContext(): def __init__(self): self._priv_data = [] self._pub_data = {} self._priv_str = "private" def set(self, **kwargs): for key, val in kwargs.items(): if key.startswith(self._priv_str): self._priv_data.append(val) else: self._pub_data[key] = val def get(self): ret_dict = self._pub_data.copy() if len(self._priv_data) > 0: ret_dict[self._priv_str] = self._priv_data[:] return ret_dict def clear(self): self._priv_data = [] self._pub_data = {} def set_priv_str(self, str_val): self._priv_str = str_val def get_priv_str(self): return self._priv_str

commit_message:
Add devtest support for power management

Updates the devtest scripts (for seed and undercloud) to
support real power management commands.

This moves us closer to parity with the old TOCI scripts
which support provisioning real hardware.

Change-Id: I5939134a79ecf825380c716c0411d00e90e22deb

commit_message:
Test tenant network resources are isolated from each other

This test fundamentally proves networks owned by a tenant
are not visible to another tenant (i.e. no leaks). Where as
the admin can see networks of both.

Change-Id: I60fbc8bc1b4e506a73082e585730ac25516b8bfb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/58/66158/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest.scenario.manager import OfficialClientManager from tempest.test import services class TestTenantResourceIsolationBasic(manager.NetworkScenarioTest): """ This test suite contains tests that each loop trying to grab a particular resource until a quota limit is hit. For sanity, there is a maximum number of iterations - if this is hit the test fails. Covers network, subnet, port. """ @classmethod def check_preconditions(cls): super(TestTenantResourceIsolationBasic, cls).check_preconditions() @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(TestTenantResourceIsolationBasic, cls).setUpClass() cls.check_preconditions() cls.networks = [] cls.subnets = [] cls.ports = [] cls.tenants = {} cls.demo_tenant = cls.TenantProperties( cls.tenant_id, *cls.credentials() ) cls.alt_tenant = cls.TenantProperties( 'alt', *cls.alt_credentials() ) for tenant in [cls.demo_tenant, cls.alt_tenant]: cls.tenants[tenant.tenant_id] = tenant @services('network') def test_verify_network_resource_isolation(self): # Use admin client to create network for each tenant t1_n1 = self._create_network(self.demo_tenant.tenant_id, namestart='tenant-isolation-') t2_n1 = self._create_network(self.alt_tenant.tenant_id, namestart='tenant-isolation-') # make unused variable warning to shut up t2_n1 = t2_n1 # look at it from admin user's perspective nets = self._list_networks() num_all = len(nets) num1 = self._get_tenant_own_network_num(self.demo_tenant.tenant_id) num2 = self._get_tenant_own_network_num(self.alt_tenant.tenant_id) self.assertEqual(num_all, num1 + num2) # ensure each tenant has one network each self.assertEqual(num1, 1) self.assertEqual(num2, 1) # now look at it from the demo user's perspective) demo_client = self.manager._get_tenant_client( self.demo_tenant.tenant_id) demo_nets = demo_client.list_networks() num_demo_cnt = len(demo_nets) self.assertEqual(num_demo_cnt, 1) demo_net = demo_nets['networks'][0] self.assertEqual(demo_net['id'], t1_n1['id']) class TenantProperties(): ''' helper class to save tenant details id credentials network subnet security groups servers access point ''' def __init__(self, tenant_id, tenant_user, tenant_pass, tenant_name): self.manager = OfficialClientManager( tenant_user, tenant_pass, tenant_name ) self.tenant_id = tenant_id self.tenant_name = tenant_name self.tenant_user = tenant_user self.tenant_pass = tenant_pass self.network = None self.subnet = None self.router = None self.security_groups = {} self.servers = list() def _set_network(self, network, subnet, router): self.network = network self.subnet = subnet self.router = router def _get_tenant_credentials(self): return self.tenant_user, self.tenant_pass, self.tenant_name

commit_message:
Disable HPET Explicitly for VMs in KVM

This commit explicitly disables HPET for all VMs
when running under KVM, as per the KVM devs' reccomendation
(all guests should use '--no-hpet' option).

Change-Id: I81c20c652fbc28386a51561f75b96334bab2b812
Implements: blueprint add-no-hpet-option-into-guest-clock
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/69066/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.info(_('Explicitly disabling HPET for' 'VM in KVM'), instance=instance) tmrhpet = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestTimer() tmrhpet.name = 'hpet' tmrhpet.present = 'no' clk.add_timer(tmrhpet)

commit_message:
Nova Docker: Metadata service doesn't work

The metadata services rejects the request because the remote IP address
belongs to the docker network. The remote IP address is correct by using
the nova network as default route.

Change-Id: I410a9bfea560f669515b31db7f007515b4d5c4e7
Closes-Bug: #1259267
Closes-Bug: #1261021

commit_message:
Destroy docker container if spawn fails to set up network

If docker driver failed to set up network when spawn an instance,
then the docker driver should also destroy the container to make
sure no garbage container left for such case.

Change-Id: I4496182d9f6a9bfd86b0a32edb19dcd975467e91
Closes-Bug: #1242815

Change-Id: I63404cfa8cd9bd850e4fc7457a3d4bcc2711685c
Closes-Bug: #1277376

commit_message:
Adding override.config.template for percona

After the 'adding configuration group support' patch was merged,
percona instance-create is failing because the TM cannot find
the override.config.template for percona. Adding this template
fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I63404cfa8cd9bd850e4fc7457a3d4bcc2711685c
Closes-Bug: #1277376
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/88/71788/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix misspellings in nova

Fix misspellings detected by:
* pip install misspellings
* git ls-files | grep -v locale | misspellings -f -

Change-Id: I4e60889368b5e83275d59562613623c417a8e03f
Closes-Bug: #1257295

commit_message:
Edits on the glossary, replace service names in glossary

First iteration of replacing service names in the glossary.

Update a few entries as well, for example AOE is now supported in
Compute.

Change-Id: I4c1534ba6f4d39d184c495c1d42c574b762c6ede

commit_message:
XenAPI: Monitor the GC when coalescing

Add a new host plugin to monitor whether the garbage collector is running.
This is then used by the wait_for_vhd_coalesce function to know whether
waiting any more is likely to produce the expected results.

Increased the number of times we loop waiting for coalesce as the loop
now has knowledge that something is still happening.

DocImpact
Change to parameter default.

Change-Id: Idcc0738945bd1aee8cdb52c9cfabd798f85c31db
Closes-bug: 1258169
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/53/60253/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use sitepackages for buildlang job

We need sitepackages set since gneratedocbook needs xml2po
which cannot be installed in the venv. Since it's installed in
the system, let's use sitepackages.

Change-Id: Ibdae32d2dd28ffe2a19b1400da84ec1f57a0fc24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/45/71945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Generatedocbook needs xml2po which cannot be installed # in the venv. Since it's installed in the system, let's # use sitepackages. sitepackages=True

Add decorator for controllers exception management

Added a decorator which manages wsme exceptions by raising a wsme
ClientSideError if a SolumException is thrown.

commit_message:
Update for doc-tools 0.6

We can do now everything in the tox file and thus minimize the
content in the jenkins file.

This needs sitepackages set since gneratedocbook needs xml2po
which cannot be installed in the venv. Since it's installed in
the system, let's use sitepackages.

Change-Id: I8c9d578c069ecd55ce9c6abe9e8d48e666962c20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/43/71943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Generatedocbook needs xml2po which cannot be installed # in the venv. Since it's installed in the system, let's # use sitepackages. sitepackages=True generatedocbook -l {posargs} -b openstack-ops

subject: Fixes XML serialization issue in Hyper-V agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 00:29:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/hyperv/agent/hyperv_neutron_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a7eabff90ebcd4575d256f0e6d8a3c9c909eaaad', 'message': 'Fixes XML serialization issue in Hyper-V agent

The XML API marshalling is not able to serialize dicts with
key values containing "*", being an invalid value for an
XML element.

This fix replaces the dictionary containing the mappings with
the corresponing string representation as speciafied in the
AGENT.physical_network_vswitch_mappings option value.

Change-Id: I477073992be911e0f24d886067c20f097c8561a9
Closes-Bug: #1277285
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes XML serialization issue in Hyper-V agent

The XML API marshalling is not able to serialize dicts with
key values containing "*", being an invalid value for an
XML element.

This fix replaces the dictionary containing the mappings with
the corresponing string representation as speciafied in the
AGENT.physical_network_vswitch_mappings option value.

Change-Id: I477073992be911e0f24d886067c20f097c8561a9
Closes-Bug: #1277285
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/98/71698/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self._physical_network_mappings},

commit_message:
Dynamic pipelines for server configuration

This patch allows admins of systems who use software that
generates/controls swift config files to add items to an existing swift
configuration that uses the conf.d-style without intruding on the
managing system.  This is done by adding a new config file in the
config.d directory with a filter section declared in it, and explicitly
declaring the ordering dependencies of that filter with other items in
the pipeline.

Other features:

Dynamic pipelines rendered under conf.d only
Added config.d documentation to proxy-server man page

Change-Id: Ia5282091a7c72f884e67e25514b7dab98c6c5702

subject: Avoid deadlock when stringifying NetworkInfo model
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 23:00:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/abacc290caf2de0667b59dd4924e994c26eed712', 'message': "Avoid deadlock when stringifying NetworkInfo model

In the libvirt driver, we log information about the instance we're
about to generate XML for, which includes a NetworkInfo model. In
reality, this is a NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper which acquires a lock
on the model. Since we're in the middle of a log statement, we also
hold the logging lock. This happens right after we've fired off an
async request to update information about the instance, which first
acquired the network model lock and then acquired the logging lock
to make a seemingly innocuous log record.

The resulting deadlock is fixed by this patch by stringifying the
NetworkInfo object before making the log call in the libvirt
driver.

Change-Id: I81f35197ab7c74daa84fb51fbaa2df28c025da13
Closes-bug: 1276268
(cherry picked from commit 072e4ad20a6a7f4fff3b59eb7ef3f6fef9aa19d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid deadlock when stringifying NetworkInfo model

In the libvirt driver, we log information about the instance we're
about to generate XML for, which includes a NetworkInfo model. In
reality, this is a NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper which acquires a lock
on the model. Since we're in the middle of a log statement, we also
hold the logging lock. This happens right after we've fired off an
async request to update information about the instance, which first
acquired the network model lock and then acquired the logging lock
to make a seemingly innocuous log record.

The resulting deadlock is fixed by this patch by stringifying the
NetworkInfo object before making the log call in the libvirt
driver.

Change-Id: I81f35197ab7c74daa84fb51fbaa2df28c025da13
Closes-bug: 1276268
(cherry picked from commit 072e4ad20a6a7f4fff3b59eb7ef3f6fef9aa19d1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/71409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(danms): Stringifying a NetworkInfo will take a lock. Do # this ahead of time so that we don't acquire it while also # holding the logging lock. network_info_str = str(network_info) LOG.debug(_('Start to_xml ' {'network_info': network_info_str, 'disk_info': disk_info, 'image_meta': image_meta, 'rescue': rescue, 'block_device_info': block_device_info})
deleted_lines: LOG.debug(_('Start to_xml instance=%(instance)s ' {'instance': instance, 'network_info': network_info, 'disk_info': disk_info, 'image_meta': image_meta, 'rescue': rescue, 'block_device_info': block_device_info})

commit_message:
Rename self.tgtadm to self.target_helper

Using "tgtadm" for this member variable is confusing because it
actually represents tgt, IET, and LIO.  Rename to a more generic
term to make things more readable.

Also remove "tgtadm" from method names and references in tests
where it is not tgtadm-specific.

I'm choosing the name "target_helper" because "tgtadm" = tgtd,
and "iscsi_helper" doesn't fit when using RDMA in ISERDriver.

Change-Id: I73fab03eb6635be6b49950e3a0ccc0e9801697ca

subject: Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 08:33:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/472c1440677440e0888570926b49542ddf260724', 'message': "Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors

cherry pick, including original commit message below from
oslo-incubator commit:

b4f72b2987d53bb434e3a833f06d70a2167f5efc

Closes bug: 1275838

Although this code error is part of the `ping_listener` tests, it was
missing from the list of known - and ignored - connection errors.

The code error 2013 refers to a connection lost during a query, see:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/error-messages-client.html#error_cr_server_lost

Without this error code, the session won't try to reconnect to mysql,
which makes `max_retries` useless.

Change-Id: Id8a1c0665468b503b092c4f01ffd40e2be9c6fa9
"}]
commit_message:
Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors

cherry pick, including original commit message below from
oslo-incubator commit:

b4f72b2987d53bb434e3a833f06d70a2167f5efc

Closes bug: 1275838

Although this code error is part of the `ping_listener` tests, it was
missing from the list of known - and ignored - connection errors.

The code error 2013 refers to a connection lost during a query, see:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/error-messages-client.html#error_cr_server_lost

Without this error code, the session won't try to reconnect to mysql,
which makes `max_retries` useless.

Change-Id: Id8a1c0665468b503b092c4f01ffd40e2be9c6fa9

commit_message:
Add utilities for supporting dotted job types

Dotted notation will allow job types to include subtype indicators,
for example MapReduce.Streaming.  With this facility, job types can
still parallel Oozie action types but contain indicators for variants
without affecting the API or database.

These utiltiy methods support extracting type and subtype and testing
a job type for membership in a list of job types.

Partial-implements: blueprint edp-dotted-job-types
Change-Id: I8d51d5567751959fb17f633a68175807b036dfb3

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Red Hat Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. JOB_TYPE_SEP = '.' def split_job_type(job_type): '''Split a job type string into a type and subtype The split is done on the first '.'. A subtype will always be returned, even if it is empty. ''' type_info = job_type.split(JOB_TYPE_SEP, 1) if len(type_info) == 1: type_info.append('') return type_info def compare_job_type(job_type, *args, **kwargs): strict = kwargs.get('strict', True) res = job_type in args if res or strict or JOB_TYPE_SEP not in job_type: return res jtype, jsubtype = split_job_type(job_type) return jtype in args

commit_message:
Add heat template for mongodb single instance

Reasons:
- trove could use heat as provisioning layer,
each new integration should come with heat template;
Changes:
- adding heat template

Implements: blueprint single-instance-mongodb-ga

Changed base Resource class to prevent changing of passed arguments

+added unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1276310

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient refs/changes/86/71086/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Mirantis Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import testtools from savannaclient.api import base class ResourceTest(testtools.TestCase): def test_create_resource(self): dict = {"name": "test"} resource = TestResource(None, dict) self.assertEqual(resource.name, "test") self.assertEqual(resource.description, "Test Description") def test_overwrite_default(self): dict = {"name": "test", "description": "Changed Description"} resource = TestResource(None, dict) self.assertEqual(resource.name, "test") self.assertEqual(resource.description, "Changed Description") self.assertEqual(resource.extra, "extra") def test_create_dont_modify_info_dict(self): dict = {"name": "test", "description": "Changed Description"} dict_copy = dict.copy() resource = TestResource(None, dict) self.assertIsNotNone(resource) self.assertEqual(dict, dict_copy) class TestResource(base.Resource): resource_name = 'Test Resource' defaults = {'description': 'Test Description', 'extra': "extra"}

commit_message:
Remove magic numbers from benchmark utils

There are many hardcoded values for sleep, timeout and poll interval in
benchmark.*.utils. This patch adds oslo config options for all of them.

Change-Id: I7ddf6244ab87e748bb2daf6502db56df13034168
Trello: https://trello.com/c/aIcMrSPM

QCOW2 = 'qcow2' RAW = 'raw' SUPPORTED_DISK = (QCOW2, RAW) class ResizeDisk(object): @staticmethod def factory(disk_info, force_cow=False): if disk_info['type'] == QCOW2: return ResizeDiskQcow2(disk_info, force_cow) elif disk_info['type'] == RAW: return ResizeDiskRaw(disk_info, force_cow) else: exception.ResizeError(reason=_("Not supported disk format." "Supported: %s.") % SUPPORTED_DISK) def __init__(self, disk_info, force_cow=False): self.disk_info = disk_info self.force_cow = force_cow @property def name(self): return os.path.basename(self.path) @property def path(self): return self.disk_info['path'] @property def type(self): return self.disk_info['type'] def convert(self, itype, otype): new_path = self.path + '_' + otype utils.execute('qemu-img', 'convert', '-f', itype, '-O', otype, self.path, new_path) return new_path def move(self, pfrom, pto): utils.execute('mv', pfrom, pto) def extends(self, size): if self.can_resize_image(size): # Only resize up are supported. self._ResizeUp(size) def can_resize_image(size): raise NotImplemented def _ResizeUp(self, size): raise NotImplemented def _ResizeDown(self, size): raise NotImplemented class ResizeDiskQcow2(ResizeDisk): def can_resize_image(self, size): return (can_resize_image(self.path, size) and is_image_partitionless( self.path, use_cow=True)) def _ResizeUp(self, size): self.move( self.convert(QCOW2, RAW), self.path) extend(self.path, size, use_cow=True) if self.force_cow: self.move( self.convert(RAW, QCOW2), self.path) class ResizeDiskRaw(ResizeDisk): def can_resize_image(self, size): # Redondant with disk.api.extend. return can_resize_image(self.path, size) def _ResizeUp(self, size): extend(self.path, size, use_cow=False) if self.force_cow: self.move( self.convert(RAW, QCOW2), self.path)

Add XenAPI to OpenStack dependencies

This way, the XenAPI package will be mirrored by the OpenStack pypi
mirror, so it could be installed in the gate.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 13:07:51.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/def860c240592f5bb594a9a2648d15b88b6c3406', 'message': 'Typo in backwards compat names for notification drivers

Change-Id: I217d6b68a64ee008a82426b890a32a97b849cb4d

commit_message:
Typo in backwards compat names for notification drivers

The switch to oslo.messaging uses setup.cfg to provide a mapping
for the Nova notification drivers, but mis-spelt them.   This will
break any existing Nova systems that use notifictaions for things
like billing, monitoring, etc

Change-Id: I217d6b68a64ee008a82426b890a32a97b849cb4d

commit_message:
Warn user when no meters in metrics panel

Avoid generating an exception by first checking if there is a
meter before calling replace method on it.
Give the user a nice warning if there are no meters available. This cannot be
done in the get method because this is an AJAX call to fetch JSON data.

Change-Id: I1536474c85083fb0bb3876e6650a3c928625a5c5
Closes-bug: #1274823

commit_message:
nova: use RequestContextSerializer for notifications

RequestContext should be serialized when sent via oslo.messaging. The
serializer is correctly used for the general RPC mechanism, but has been
forgotten in the notifier. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I56fa8022e34c0e80835e3bde940fda99ed0f9ba8
Closes-Bug: #1275771
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/71532/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NOTIFIER = messaging.Notifier(TRANSPORT, serializer=RequestContextSerializer(None))
deleted_lines: NOTIFIER = messaging.Notifier(TRANSPORT)

commit_message:
service: re-enable eventlet just for sockets

This reenables eventlet monkey patching, but just for socket, as that
should be enough to get oslo.rpc unblocked and have the event loop
running.

Change-Id: I5e9b77a7931ceb69eac458634acdc904e30f0e3d
Fixes-Bug: #127460

Expose the stats attribute on a queue

The patch fixes other 2 issues caused by the implementation of Message
objects.

Co-Authored: Alex Gaynor <alex.gaynor@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I0e9abd3e197ecc2d73f16395becd479a3157c6b4

commit_message:
Adds basic tests which deals with exceptions

The actual tooz tests cover the situations where no exception
is raised. This commit adds some tests that deals with the cases
where a group and/or a member are nonexistent or already exists.
Then it checks that the right exception is raised.

Change-Id: I863cfb0e863aee49376e284f88413a4aefb2ca9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/58/71858/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_join_nonexistent_group(self): group_id_test = self._get_random_uuid() join_group = self._coord.join_group(group_id_test) self.assertRaises(tooz.coordination.GroupNotCreated, join_group.get ) def test_join_group_with_member_id_already_exists(self): self._coord.create_group(self.group_id).get() self._coord.join_group(self.group_id).get() client = tooz.coordination.get_coordinator(self.backend, self.member_id, **self.kwargs) client.start() join_group = client.join_group(self.group_id) self.assertRaises(tooz.coordination.MemberAlreadyExist, join_group.get ) def test_leave_nonexistent_group(self): all_group_ids = self._coord.get_groups().get() self.assertTrue(self.group_id not in all_group_ids) leave_group = self._coord.leave_group(self.group_id) self.assertRaises(tooz.coordination.MemberNotJoined, leave_group.get) def test_leave_group_not_joined_by_member(self): self._coord.create_group(self.group_id).get() all_group_ids = self._coord.get_groups().get() self.assertTrue(self.group_id in all_group_ids) join_group = self._coord.leave_group(self.group_id) self.assertRaises(tooz.coordination.MemberNotJoined, join_group.get) def test_update_capabilities_with_group_id_nonexistent(self): update_cap = self._coord.update_capabilities(self.group_id, b'test_capabilities') self.assertRaises(tooz.coordination.MemberNotJoined, update_cap.get)

Adds meta and head-js partials to head in base.html

commit_message:
CRUD operations for external network

Added a testcase "test_create_list_update_show_delete_ext_network_subnet"
to script test_external_networks.py in tempest "/api/network/admin/".
Also modified supporting network client methos so as to set flag
"router:external" as True.

Change-Id: I3d16c8418932cd7379fa0ddeae5e30be4fbf15b4

commit_message:
Fix swiftclient help

Command help was wrong in two cases. While we're at it, add some
defaults to help and change some brackets to be consistent with
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Command-line_interface#Command_description_syntax

Change-Id: If03e9df188460af7b3fa56a8e0a033b30bf4ab47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/76/71876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Number of threads to use for deleting objects. Default is 10 Number of threads to use for deleting containers. Default is 10 <container> [object] [object] Name of object to download. Specify multiple times Number of threads to use for downloading objects. Default is 10 Number of threads to use for downloading containers. Default is 10 help='Number of threads to use for downloading containers')st_list_options = '''[--long] [--lh] [--totals] [--prefix <prefix>] [--delimiter <delimiter>] [container] [object] [container] Name of container to stat from [object] Name of object to stat. commit_message:
Policy check needs to check for None in target

For objects that don't have a project_id attached to them, the
property can be set to None, which does not get overridden in
the policy engine where it being not set currently does.  This
adds a check for user_id and project_id being None and setting them
if they are.

Change-Id: I7aeb6d3830a19a7191de9944f8de90ee12dbf127
Closes-bug: #1274053

commit_message:
L3 Agent can handle many external networks

With this patch a l3 agent can handle
any networks by setting the neutron
parameter external_network_bridge
and gateway_external_network_id to
empty.

Related-Bug: #1234750
Related-Bug: #1194350

(cherry picked from commit b5092af696131e611e20f17c6b9aa4f321a854df)

Change-Id: Ic0b0ba26a04cc0f6f12fc7ddb0fbad5088b07f58

= ( n_exc.TooManyExternalNetworks()) self.assertRaises(n_exc.TooManyExternalNetworks, agent._process_routers, routers) self.assertNotIn(routers[0]['id'], agent.router_info) def commit_message:
Make Database Interactions More Transactional

Change from manual rollbacks in storage when downstream failures
happen to SQL-like rollbacks. Phase 1 of the Bulk Actions blueprint.

bp/bulk-modify-delete

Change-Id: I40efcccab5e8b813728ba48d47882896e63041df

commit_message:
Fixes TypeError in _leave_group_handler

When catching NoNondeError exception In the _leave_group_handler
function, Missing brackets in string formating of MemberNotJoined
exception message raise a TypeError exception with the message
"TypeError: not enough arguments for format string"

Change-Id: I908a783a6ce912d5bfe6be33288d3b1a3ea93ab3

Rubocop warns about doing a rescue on Exception:

and calls to\xa0exit, requiring you to\xa0kill -9the process."

commit_message:
Fix 'Avoid rescuing the Exception class.' warnings

Rubocop warns about doing a rescue on Exception:
"Avoid rescuing the Exception class. This will trap signals
and calls to exit, requiring you to kill -9the process."

According to the style guide, we should be catching StandardError
instead, which doesn't trap exit signals. This patch addresses that
issue.

Change-Id: I6cf3e6b5cecfdc4d412789d75e1af9e6d53c6e8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-identity refs/changes/95/71695/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
use openrc credentials to verify swift installation

Don't use the keystone admin token to authenticate, but a real user
instead (using the openrc.sh config file). This simplifies the swift
commands, and makes the verification more consistent with the
verification of other services.

Change-Id: I6a2512cb6cbb2942c9e8673f3f7d960f2f740e8e
backport: none
(cherry picked from commit 31f384e6260f3bfe8864909537d982f0033c511d)

If you do not wish to have the swift admin password stored in your shell's history, you can run the following command:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>export SWIFT_PROXY_CONF=/etc/swift/proxy-server.conf export OS_PASSWORD=$( grep admin_password ${SWIFT_PROXY_CONF} | awk '{ print $NF }' )</userinput></screen> </note> <step><para>Run the following swift command with the correct Identity Service URL:</para><screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>swift -V 2.0 -A $OS_AUTH_URL -U demo:admin -K $ADMINPASS stat</userinput> <para>Run the following swift commands to upload files to a container (create a test text files if needed):</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>swift -V 2.0 -A $OS_AUTH_URL -U demo:admin -K $OS_PASSWORD upload myfiles test.txt</userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>swift -V 2.0 -A $OS_AUTH_URL -U demo:admin -K $ADMINPASS upload myfiles test2.txt</userinput></screen> <para>Run the following swift command to download all files from the ‘myfiles’ container:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>swift -V 2.0 -A $OS_AUTH_URL -U demo:admin -K $ADMINPASS download myfiles</userinput></screen> <screen><computeroutput>test2.txt [headers 0.267s, total 0.267s, 0.000s MB/s]

commit_message:
Move resource_templates to heat.scaling

This introduces a new package for autoscaling code which is
intended for use outside of the Heat engine, and moves the
resource_templates function into a new module, heat.scaling.template.
The function hasn't been changed at all.

Change-Id: I78c420e7a188f2d14780a03b3ea220b9a5fbe86c
Implements: partial blueprint as-lib

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat.common import short_id def resource_templates(old_resources, resource_definition, num_resources, num_replace): """ Create the template for the nested stack of existing and new instances For rolling update, if launch configuration is different, the instance definition should come from the existing instance instead of using the new launch configuration. """ num_create = num_resources - len(old_resources) num_replace -= num_create def instance_templates(num_replace): for i in range(num_resources): if i < len(old_resources): old_name, old_template = old_resources[i] if old_template != resource_definition and num_replace > 0: num_replace -= 1 yield old_name, resource_definition else: yield old_name, old_template else: yield short_id.generate_id(), resource_definition return list(instance_templates(num_replace))

commit_message:
Remove copyright from empty files

According to policy change in HACKING:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing
empty files should no longer contain copyright notices.

Change-Id: Icad4ffa9843baeb9c437d2e2c0b0d35c24abc68a
Closes-Bug: #1262424
