all is good. Otherwise, it is dropped.

Change-Id: I07c7996ee76873ee762582e58dbbec05bc7de66c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-21 17:30:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/d30830aeafb138dd61326ec7c0d55828d5f7bed9', 'message': "Better socket termination for ZeroMQ

We were telling ZeroMQ to close sockets,
but only after successfully sending them.
If a socket timed out, we'd drop the reference
from Python, but the ZeroMQ library was still
keeping these sockets alive in the background.

Instead of using eventlet's Timeout,
we can simply use the linger argument to
terminate sockets if they're alive for too
long. If the message sends before the timeout,
all is good. Otherwise, it is dropped.

Fixes bug 1193439

Change-Id: I07c7996ee76873ee762582e58dbbec05bc7de66c
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-09 16:37:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/a129856c5d08c05cfac7413624cb9e81afc0909b', 'message': 'Better socket termination for ZeroMQ

Sending and closing ZeroMQ sockets only
block on access to the file descriptor,
not on the sending of data or the closing
of sockets.

As such, the timeout in _cast() was ineffective and
resulted in immediately calling close().

Because close() defaults to linger=-1, the underlying
file descriptor (managed by a ZeroMQ thread spawned
within the C library) would only be closed
upon the successful sending of the message.

This would result in a file descriptor leak and
infinite attempts to deliver messages despite
the timeout per message sent to a non-existant consumer.

The solution is to use the linger
argument to expire the messages if they cannot
be delivered within the timeout window.

Adds a test to test_zmq that assures messages cast
to a topic cannot be consumed after the expiration
of the cast timeout.

Fixes bug 1193439

Change-Id: I07c7996ee76873ee762582e58dbbec05bc7de66c

commit_message:
Better socket termination for ZeroMQ

Sending and closing ZeroMQ sockets only
block on access to the file descriptor,
not on the sending of data or the closing
of sockets.

As such, the timeout in _cast() was ineffective and
resulted in immediately calling close().

Because close() defaults to linger=-1, the underlying
file descriptor (managed by a ZeroMQ thread spawned
within the C library) would only be closed
upon the successful sending of the message.

This would result in a file descriptor leak and
infinite attempts to deliver messages despite
the timeout per message sent to a non-existant consumer.

The solution is to use the linger
argument to expire the messages if they cannot
be delivered within the timeout window.

This patch also removes the eventlet spawn in
_multi_send as it was unnecessary and caused a
race-condition discovered by the new test. Now,
calling cast() will block on the completion of
_cast() -- ensuring messages are locally enqueued
before returning. (It does NOT block on the delivery
of a message)

Adds a tests to test_zmq that assures messages cast
to a topic cannot be consumed after the expiration
of the cast timeout and, to complete coverage, of
the new code, that messages may generally be
consumed following a message cast.

Fixes bug 1193439

Change-Id: I07c7996ee76873ee762582e58dbbec05bc7de66c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/81/33881/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def close(self, linger=-1): self.sock.close(linger) def close(self, linger): self.outq.close(linger) try: conn = ZmqClient(addr) # assumes cast can't return an exception conn.cast(_msg_id, topic, payload, envelope) conn.close(timeout_cast) except zmq.ZMQError: raise RPCException("Cast failed. ZMQ Socket Exception")
deleted_lines: def close(self): self.sock.close() def close(self): self.outq.close() with Timeout(timeout_cast, exception=rpc_common.Timeout): try: conn = ZmqClient(addr) # assumes cast can't return an exception conn.cast(_msg_id, topic, payload, envelope) except zmq.ZMQError: raise RPCException("Cast failed. ZMQ Socket Exception") finally: if 'conn' in vars(): conn.close()

subject: New module to import into httpd for speedup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-03 21:30:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/httpd/import_this.py', 'keystone/httpd/__init__.py', 'httpd/keystone.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/4080fd40b7d1e0061fda7064e561acff9e747373', 'message': "New module to import into httpd for speedup

Apache httpd has a configuration option to pre-import modules
(WSGIImportScript). If WSGIImportScript isn't used, then the
modules aren't loaded until the first request comes in, so that
first request will take longer due to the overhead of parsing the
modules.

The httpd scripts that we provided weren't appropriate for importing
because it did too much, specifically it would configure() every
time.

This change introduces a script keystone/httpd/import_this.py that
can be used with WSGIImportScript like so:

 WSGIImportScript /opt/stack/keystone/keystone/httpd/import_this.py
     process-group=keystone application-group=%{GLOBAL}

This is optional, if this option isn't set in the httpd configuration
the scripts run as normal.

Change-Id: I83a587307f18948811c34a54891bea0ec169791d
"}]
commit_message:
New module to import into httpd for speedup

Apache httpd has a configuration option to pre-import modules
(WSGIImportScript). If WSGIImportScript isn't used, then the
modules aren't loaded until the first request comes in, so that
first request will take longer due to the overhead of parsing the
modules.

The httpd scripts that we provided weren't appropriate for importing
because it did too much, specifically it would configure() every
time.

This change introduces a script keystone/httpd/import_this.py that
can be used with WSGIImportScript like so:

 WSGIImportScript /opt/stack/keystone/keystone/httpd/import_this.py
     process-group=keystone application-group=%{GLOBAL}

This is optional, if this option isn't set in the httpd configuration
the scripts run as normal.

Change-Id: I83a587307f18948811c34a54891bea0ec169791d

Change-Id: I1bf3f0f3df9b5dc89b4ee409ee114190587c848e

commit_message:
The federation protocol profile for a remote Keystone IdP (Federation pt4)

Change-Id: I1bf3f0f3df9b5dc89b4ee409ee114190587c848e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api refs/changes/35/61835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack Identity API v3 Keystone Profile for Federation ===================================================== The federated authentication plugin delegates all the protocol dependent functionality to protocol specific modules. Each federation protocol needs a profile to describe the required request and response messages. Note that this is independent of the actual implementation. This document describes the profile for a remote Keystone identity provider. The Keystone protocol specific module is added by creating a module called "keystone". In order for this module to be executed, the discovery service must return the type "keystone". ###### The `keystone` authentication profile 1. No protocol specific request parameters are required for the Keystone profile to handle the issuing of an authentication request. The request message should conform to the structure laid out in the federation extension document, viz: Request: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "phase": "request", "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "keystone", "protocol_data": [] } } } } The response for the Keystone profile must contain the endpoint of the remote Keystone identity provider within the protocol_data field. Response: { "error": { "message": "Additional authentication steps required.", "code": 401, "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "keystone", "protocol_data": [ { "endpoint": "https://keystoneZ.com:5000/v3/auth" } ] } }, "title": "Unauthorized" } } 2. The negotiation phase for Keystone is not used, and if an attempt is made to perform a negotiation with a Keystone Identity Provider then a NotImplemented exception is raised. 3. The Keystone profile expects that the protocol_data provided during the validation phase contains a Keystone token either in PKI format or as a UUID. If a PKI token is returned, then the implementation will need to have access to the CA certificate and public key certificate of the Keystone IDP. If a UUID token is returned, then the implementation will need the login details of an admin user for the Keystone IDP. Request: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "phase": "validate", "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "keystone", "protocol_data": [ { "data": "<keystone token>" } ] } } } } The response for the Keystone profile validation is the same as the standard response described in the Authentication Plugin For Federations document.

commit_message:
Make context available during constraint validation

This makes context optionally available in properties and during
constraint validation, to be able to add more advanced constraints which
make API calls.

blueprint param-constraints

Change-Id: I6ec1d6bc952d82029638caea32567036e29e4881

commit_message:
Mock sys.exit in testing

If exit is called during subunit then it exits the subunit process which
makes the test suite fail with no information.

Change-Id: I7c189fad05f0d38c35e4014ff414d91841bc7632
Closes-Bug: #1276885

commit_message:
Return single unicode type from exception messages

Instead of returning mixed str vs unicode types from
the exception_message function just return a single
type (unicode) and try different variations of encodings
to achieve the final unicode string.

Change-Id: I7ecd882a36a226f3c1dc3447a6930ae49b347637
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/12/71312/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Return the unicode representation of exception.""" pass for (encoding, errors) in (('utf-8', 'strict'), ("latin-1", "strict")): try: return six.binary_type(exc).decode(encoding=encoding, errors=errors) except UnicodeError: pass return six.binary_type(exc).decode(encoding="utf-8", errors='replace')
deleted_lines: """Return the string representation of exception.""" return str(exc)

subject: Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-22 19:58:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1f967eb5641ea2d694a16644d47433d47ec3f021', 'message': "Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure

I found that multiple calls to delete_port can pile up on the
_recycle_ip operation.  This patch simplifies this operation.  It
reduces the _recycle_ip operation to a single row delete in the ip
allocations table and doesn't touch the availability table.

To acheive the recycling of ips in a pool, this code runs a more
complex operation of rebuilding the availability table when it is
exhausted.  Only one API process will perform this more expensive
operation and others waiting for allocation will immediately benefit.
The amortized cost of this operation is much less than the cumulative
cost of running the more expensive _recycle_ip operation for every
port delete.

IP allocation behaves a bit differently with this patch.  Instead of
giving out the first IP available in a pool, the entire pool will be
allocated before wrapping around and recycling ip addresses that have
been released.  This is a desirable feature as it puts ip addresses in
a sort of quarantine after they are released.  It is easier to
distinguish newly allocated ips from old ones.

Change-Id: Ia55b66128de9986e075b0f87acc401d211cd91d3
Closes-Bug: #1252506
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-11-22 20:37:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9df97443149863bd4f46d88baef58f6fdb39d0e8', 'message': "Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure

Closes-Bug: #1252506
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2013-11-22 21:17:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1880bdbf1f6ce88fdd39f06c42ef55720368207c', 'message': "Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure

I found that multiple calls to delete_port can pile up on the
_recycle_ip operation.  This patch simplifies this operation.  It
reduces the _recycle_ip operation to a single row delete in the ip
allocations table and doesn't touch the availability table.

To acheive the recycling of ips in a pool, this code runs a more
complex operation of rebuilding the availability table when it is
exhausted.  Only one API process will perform this more expensive
operation and others waiting for allocation will immediately benefit.
The amortized cost of this operation is much less than the cumulative
cost of running the more expensive _recycle_ip operation for every
port delete.

IP allocation behaves a bit differently with this patch.  Instead of
giving out the first IP available in a pool, the entire pool will be
allocated before wrapping around and recycling ip addresses that have
been released.  This is a desirable feature as it puts ip addresses in
a sort of quarantine after they are released.  It is easier to
distinguish newly allocated ips from old ones.

Change-Id: Ia55b66128de9986e075b0f87acc401d211cd91d3
Closes-Bug: #1252506
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2013-12-03 18:26:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fe9d989f6bd80e258e934f0bd478d35c4fd85ad2', 'message': "Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure

commit_message:
Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure

I found that multiple calls to delete_port can pile up on the
_recycle_ip operation.  This patch simplifies this operation.  It
reduces the _recycle_ip operation to a single row delete in the ip
allocations table and doesn't touch the availability table.

To acheive the recycling of ips in a pool, this code runs a more
complex operation of rebuilding the availability table when it is
exhausted.  Only one API process will perform this more expensive
operation and others waiting for allocation will immediately benefit.
The amortized cost of this operation is much less than the cumulative
cost of running the more expensive _recycle_ip operation for every
port delete.

IP allocation behaves a bit differently with this patch.  Instead of
giving out the first IP available in a pool, the entire pool will be
allocated before wrapping around and recycling ip addresses that have
been released.  This is a desirable feature as it puts ip addresses in
a sort of quarantine after they are released.  It is easier to
distinguish newly allocated ips from old ones.

Change-Id: Ia55b66128de9986e075b0f87acc401d211cd91d3
Closes-Bug: #1252506
Closes-Bug: #1257815
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/17/58017/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: return NeutronDbPluginV2._generate_ip_work(context, subnets) except q_exc.IpAddressGenerationFailure: NeutronDbPluginV2._rebuild_availability_ranges(context, subnets) return NeutronDbPluginV2._generate_ip_work(context, subnets) @staticmethod def _generate_ip_work(context, subnets): def _rebuild_availability_ranges(context, subnets): ip_qry = context.session.query( models_v2.IPAllocation).with_lockmode('update') pool_qry = context.session.query( models_v2.IPAllocationPool).with_lockmode('update') for subnet in subnets: LOG.debug(_("Rebuilding availability ranges for subnet %s") % subnet) # Create a set of all currently allocated addresses ip_qry_results = ip_qry.filter_by(subnet_id=subnet['id']) ips = netaddr.IPSet([netaddr.IPAddress(i['ip_address']) for i in ip_qry_results]) # Create a set of all addresses in the pool for pool in pool_qry.filter_by(subnet_id=subnet['id']): poolset = netaddr.IPSet() range = netaddr.IPRange(pool['first_ip'], pool['last_ip']) for cidr in range.cidrs(): poolset.add(cidr) poolset.compact() available = poolset - ips available.compact() for cidr in available.iter_cidrs(): ip_range = models_v2.IPAvailabilityRange( allocation_pool_id=pool['id'], first_ip=str(netaddr.IPAddress(cidr.first)), last_ip=str(netaddr.IPAddress(cidr.last))) context.session.add(ip_range) @staticmethod
deleted_lines: import itertools # Grab all allocation pools for the subnet allocation_pools = (context.session.query( models_v2.IPAllocationPool).filter_by(subnet_id=subnet_id). options(orm.joinedload('available_ranges', innerjoin=True)). with_lockmode('update')) # If there are no available ranges the previous query will return no # results as it uses an inner join to avoid errors with the postgresql # backend (see lp bug 1215350). In this case IP allocation pools must # be loaded with a different query, which does not require lock for # update as the allocation pools for a subnet are immutable. # The 2nd query will be executed only if the first yields no results unlocked_allocation_pools = (context.session.query( models_v2.IPAllocationPool).filter_by(subnet_id=subnet_id)) # Find the allocation pool for the IP to recycle pool_id = None for allocation_pool in itertools.chain(allocation_pools, unlocked_allocation_pools): allocation_pool_range = netaddr.IPRange( allocation_pool['first_ip'], allocation_pool['last_ip']) if netaddr.IPAddress(ip_address) in allocation_pool_range: pool_id = allocation_pool['id'] break if not pool_id: NeutronDbPluginV2._delete_ip_allocation( context, network_id, subnet_id, ip_address) return # Two requests will be done on the database. The first will be to # search if an entry starts with ip_address + 1 (r1). The second # will be to see if an entry ends with ip_address -1 (r2). # If 1 of the above holds true then the specific entry will be # modified. If both hold true then the two ranges will be merged. # If there are no entries then a single entry will be added. range_qry = context.session.query( models_v2.IPAvailabilityRange).with_lockmode('update') ip_first = str(netaddr.IPAddress(ip_address) + 1) ip_last = str(netaddr.IPAddress(ip_address) - 1) LOG.debug(_("Recycle %s"), ip_address) try: r1 = range_qry.filter_by(allocation_pool_id=pool_id, first_ip=ip_first).one() LOG.debug(_("Recycle: first match for %(first_ip)s-%(last_ip)s"), {'first_ip': r1['first_ip'], 'last_ip': r1['last_ip']}) except exc.NoResultFound: r1 = [] try: r2 = range_qry.filter_by(allocation_pool_id=pool_id, last_ip=ip_last).one() LOG.debug(_("Recycle: last match for %(first_ip)s-%(last_ip)s"), {'first_ip': r2['first_ip'], 'last_ip': r2['last_ip']}) except exc.NoResultFound: r2 = [] if r1 and r2: # Merge the two ranges ip_range = models_v2.IPAvailabilityRange( allocation_pool_id=pool_id, first_ip=r2['first_ip'], last_ip=r1['last_ip']) context.session.add(ip_range) LOG.debug(_("Recycle: merged %(first_ip1)s-%(last_ip1)s and " "%(first_ip2)s-%(last_ip2)s"), {'first_ip1': r2['first_ip'], 'last_ip1': r2['last_ip'], 'first_ip2': r1['first_ip'], 'last_ip2': r1['last_ip']}) context.session.delete(r1) context.session.delete(r2) elif r1: # Update the range with matched first IP r1['first_ip'] = ip_address LOG.debug(_("Recycle: updated first %(first_ip)s-%(last_ip)s"), {'first_ip': r1['first_ip'], 'last_ip': r1['last_ip']}) elif r2: # Update the range with matched last IP r2['last_ip'] = ip_address LOG.debug(_("Recycle: updated last %(first_ip)s-%(last_ip)s"), {'first_ip': r2['first_ip'], 'last_ip': r2['last_ip']}) else: # Create a new range ip_range = models_v2.IPAvailabilityRange( allocation_pool_id=pool_id, first_ip=ip_address, last_ip=ip_address) context.session.add(ip_range) LOG.debug(_("Recycle: created new %(first_ip)s-%(last_ip)s"), {'first_ip': ip_address, 'last_ip': ip_address})

subject: Allow environment to not have resource_registry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 21:04:01.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_template_utils.py', 'heatclient/common/template_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient/commit/24913c91b5f380ce525845dc58e6bfcde8c1780c', 'message': 'Allow environment to not have resource_registry

If you try to use an environment file that contains only parameters,
or even nothing, you get a NoneType error as the client is expecting
there to be a value in the resource_registry section. This stops that
error, thus allowing environment files to be empty or just contain
parameters.

Change-Id: I0c6c3bb60182915df346ebf8dd4e98ccc652ffb1
Closes-Bug: #1273881
'}]
commit_message:
Allow environment to not have resource_registry

If you try to use an environment file that contains only parameters,
or even nothing, you get a NoneType error as the client is expecting
there to be a value in the resource_registry section. This stops that
error, thus allowing environment files to be empty or just contain
parameters.

Change-Id: I0c6c3bb60182915df346ebf8dd4e98ccc652ffb1
Closes-Bug: #1273881
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/79/71379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if resource_registry is None: return

subject: [ML2] l2-pop MD handle multi create/delete ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-24 12:22:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ee33d96d11309a39e38e155eea9907f744bca0ce', 'message': '[ML2] l2-pop MD handle multi create/delete ports

If more than one port is added or removed simultaneously, port db entry
have status BUILD or DOWN and pass to ACTIVE when agent have finish to
configured it.
l2-pop mechanism driver use events port pass to ACTIVE or DOWN to send
fdb entries. In case of port is the first or the last network port on
an agent, the flooding entry need to be add or removed.

This patch fix the method to determine how many ports are active on a
agent by adding filter on status port to be ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I9c1f8bd69dee37bc01a5d42327aa5f737998c5aa

commit_message:
[ML2] l2-pop MD handle multi create/delete ports

If more than one port is added or removed simultaneously, port db entry
have status BUILD or DOWN and pass to ACTIVE when agent have finish to
configured it.
l2-pop mechanism driver use events port pass to ACTIVE or DOWN to send
fdb entries. In case of port is the first or the last network port on
an agent, the flooding entry need to be add or removed.

This patch fix the method to determine how many ports are active on a
agent by adding filter on status port to be ACTIVE.

Closes-bug: #1263881
Change-Id: I9c1f8bd69dee37bc01a5d42327aa5f737998c5aa

commit_message:
Tweak version nvp/nsx version validation logic for router operations

This patch improves how the nsx/nvp controller version is validated
prior to some router operations. This is done by greatly simplifying
the boolean condition.

Missing unit tests are also added for increased coverage.

Closes-bug: 1274361

Change-Id: I1b21444fd86b6e6a0c72bb5a43f1707934dd70e4

commit_message:
Fix a bug in v3 API doc

This patch changes the wrong variable names 'addFixedIp' and 'networkId',
which were not used in V3 multinic API. We use 'add_fixed_ip' and
'network_id' in V3 multinic API.

Closes-bug: #1265716

Change-Id: I0c91764603d941df6d011a3b1266eb354c0bc54f

commit_message:
vmware: intermittent failure in test_vmware_vmdk

There was a race condition between the two Event() objects being
created within loopingcall and Retry in api module. Did away with
the Event object in Retry and used loopingcall the right way.

Change-Id: I2534bad9294747fcd618ba3634abb01ceef92213

commit_message:
Move strip version method to the HTTP client class

 * Applications using the glanceclient on the API level will be unaware of that implementation
detail.
 * If there is any change in this in the future, other applications will not need to change.
 * Added some tests for the strip version method

Change-Id: I0267159b71f3086780f3d32f4687e008357ac9e1
Closes-Bug: #1269821

commit_message:
Fix bittorrent URL configuration option

This change modifies bittorrent to give URL setting preference to the
configuration option first and then to entry point addins.  The thought
process is that users will want the ability to change the URL
via configuration.  The entry point is code and slower to address.

If the user really wants to use the entry point, they can leave
the configuration option empty.

Existing test cases updated to reflect new priority.

Change-Id: I5af94b4b50531fc7801e70d83b89dd7ed2bcf310

commit_message:
API schema for v3 console_output API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: Id6330e2250448c54679df4f27af25c2614a871f0

deleted_lines: from nova.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ try: length = body['get_console_output'].get('length') except (TypeError, KeyError): raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(_('get_console_output malformed ' 'or missing from request body')) if length is not None: try: # NOTE(maurosr): cast length into a string before cast into an # integer to avoid thing like: int(2.5) which is 2 instead of # raise ValueError like it would when we try int("2.5"). This # can be removed once we have api validation landed. int(str(length)) except ValueError: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(_('Length in request body must ' 'be an integer value'))

commit_message:
Fix exception handling miss in remote_consoles.

The ConsoleTypeUnavailable exception raised in
nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py is not handled, and will make
nova api and compute fail.
This patch fixes this bug.

Closes-bug: #1270076

Change-Id: I6ff7a40bf26dbef4bd5512a9c3c4a8664a664244

commit_message:
Ignore 'dynamic' addr flag on bridge configuration

When setting the bridge up, if that flag is present but not
ignored, the delete command will fail and may leave the
interface and the bridge in an inconsistent state.

Closes-Bug: #1274611
Related-Bug: #1077066
Change-Id: Iff65d61d724d0de5d8173ac37f7f748aa23e5d8b

commit_message:
ip_address_show should not raise exception

* The FuelWebClient.ip_address_show raised error if 'ip address show'
command returns nothing (return 1). But caller expects string. So
if ip command returns 1 the method should return empty string.
* Add additional parameter to the method to make it more universal.
The parameter is pipe string / commands and it is possible to grep
within the method

Change-Id: Ibf14c54c4439d8403a1058f0991363e18362ca35
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/62/69362/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from devops.error import DevopsCalledProcessError def ip_address_show(self, node_name, interface, pipe_str=''): try: remote = self.get_ssh_for_node(node_name) ret = remote.check_call( 'ip address show {0} {1}'.format(interface, pipe_str)) return ' '.join(ret['stdout']) except DevopsCalledProcessError: pass return ''
deleted_lines: def ip_address_show(self, node_name, interface): remote = self.get_ssh_for_node(node_name) ret = remote.check_call( 'ip address show {0} | grep ka$'.format(interface)) return ' '.join(ret['stdout'])

commit_message:
Make .expiring_objects account name configurable

The account which tracks objects scheduled for deletion had its name
hard-coded to 'expiring_objects'. This is made configurable via
expiring_objects_account_name option. Backend file-systems
integration efforts may want to treat these "special" accounts in a
different way.

This would still go undocumented, hence 'pseudo-hidden'.

UpgradeImpact: None as the default value would continue to be the same
               which is '.expiring_objects'.

Change-Id: I1a093b0d0e2bdd0c3d723090af03fc0adf2ad7e3
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/78/70978/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix deadlock on waiting for pending_writers to be empty

Deadlock can occur when a reader X waits for pending writers
to be empty but the reader X already owns a read lock (since
it will then wait for pending writers to be empty which it
will never be, since pending writers is only empty when
there are no readers - but since the current thread X is getting
another read lock it result in deadlock for the reader and
deadlock for the writer).

Closes-Bug: #1276868

Change-Id: Ibe13eafa4bd0bc817e8bfe3cf303c54298778b37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/26/71426/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # No active writer; we are good to become a reader. if self._writer is None: # An active writer; guess we have to wait.
deleted_lines: # No active or pending writers; we are good to become a reader. if self._writer is None and len(self._pending_writers) == 0: # Some writers; guess we have to wait.

subject: Add serializer capability to fake_notifier.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-04 03:58:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/df5199bd33595d271e0922b4cb14aa75beae8318', 'message': 'Add serializer capability to fake_notifier.

With the change to oslo.messaging.notify.Notifier, we have
introduced the serializer plugin.  In some implementations
this is used to modify the notfications/serialize data.  The
implementations will want to test their serializers and
the easiest way to do this is via the fake_notifier.
This change allows fake_notifier to act more like
notifier with serializer being a pass in as an argument.

The serializer is passed to subnotifiers created via
the prepare method.

Change-Id: I03ef9ed92366961d4e296381d149c54d7da97f70

commit_message:
Add serializer capability to fake_notifier.

With the change to oslo.messaging.notify.Notifier, we have
introduced the serializer plugin.  In some implementations
this is used to modify the notfications/serialize data.  The
implementations will want to test their serializers and
the easiest way to do this is via the fake_notifier.
This change allows fake_notifier to act more like
notifier with serializer being a pass in as an argument.

The serializer is passed to subnotifiers created via
the prepare method.

Change-Id: I03ef9ed92366961d4e296381d149c54d7da97f70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/07/70907/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def __init__(self, transport, publisher_id): return self.__class__(self.transport, publisher_id) stubs.Set(rpc, 'NOTIFIER', FakeNotifier(rpc.NOTIFIER.transport, rpc.NOTIFIER.publisher_id))

commit_message:
Rename package from oslo.sphinx to oslosphinx

Having the sphinx theme in the same namespace package
as the production code has been causing issues with
devstack installations. This change renames the package
to move it out of the namespace. Another change to the
openstack-infra/config repository will rename the
git repository and associated jobs.

Partial-bug: #1277168

Change-Id: I7788a9d6b5984fdfcc4678f2182104d2eb8a2be0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslosphinx refs/changes/89/71589/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make nova-network use FixedIP object for associations

This makes nova-network manager use the FixedIP.associate*
calls instead of going direct to the database.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I60f287f10bee45980e3671d73102a582c805436f

commit_message:
No need to loop over with pkill -f

I guess four times is better than one but if we need four times to kill
swift processes there is something pretty bad with it.

Change-Id: Id2ea2f4ca60feb9fddc7b3181063760d2044b421

commit_message:
Honor install prefix

No need to put 'usr/' in front of data files, distros have the default
prefix set to '/usr' already such that 'setup.py install' does the right
thing. Compare with the results of 'python setup.py bdist'.

Change-Id: I8d7f592abece22f8bb70deede776509cdd1446e5

commit_message:
Add while/until to the for/do rule

Like 'for/do' check that the while/until operator are on
the same line with the do.

Fixes some pep8 error along the way.

Change-Id: I440afe60691263365bf35310bf4212d94f30c339

commit_message:
Tests initialize database

Many tests (for example the backend_kvs tests) failed to run
individually. This is because the tests made the assumption that
because the system is configured for the KVS (or non-SQL) backend
that the database isn't required. The problem with this assumption
is that different backends can use different storage mechanisms,
and the credential backend only supports SQL. So any test that
requires that backends are loaded is required to initialize the
database.

Change-Id: I109b83bf512598952346bef01dc33c57802c7f60

commit_message:
glance-manage wont take version into consideration

A glance-manage db upgrade/db downgrade will do either an 'upgrade to
latest' or 'downgrade to None' even though a version argument is
provided. The version being passed isn't being picked up and None is
passed across.

Fixes bug 1258068
Change-Id: Iaab4cf5eeb6d7c9c94fc741841a6b0797a058d40

commit_message:
VMware: Remove some unused variables

Remove unused variables from the following files:

* nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py
* nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py
* nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py

There is no design to the above selection of files: this is simply as
I have encountered them.

Change-Id: I43ee2f71edf5872bfe1b1fe010e83435689501bb

commit_message:
Fix policy.py

Because inside check_policy() there is hardcoded
'share' target prepended to all policies, any
policy we check will be checked against 'share'
policy. Change check_policy() to use explicit
target and action instead of just action.
Change wrap_check_policy decorator to be a
decorator maker which accepts resource name
as an argument.
Closes-Bug: #1274951
Partial-Bug: #1271943

Change-Id: I85c184035619d78107d56ea94918f608d8d7c282

commit_message:
Squash all migrations into one

Migration #12 have fixed bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1272303,
but introduced a new one. Because that bug
was rather architectural, we need to address
that architectural flaw instead of fixing
bugs as they come.
Closes-Bug: #1275044

Change-Id: I260a90abd1107c62b687118d5d4a01d7199ea56f

change doesn't cope well with the new format of column names.

change doesn't cope well with the new format of column names.

Change-Id: Iec39c8804ea47307a98d1b79899ff74af9404bf6

commit_message:
Fix parsing of UC errors in sqlite 3.7.16+/3.8.2+

The new version of libsqlite changed the format of error messages.
Code of oslo.db helpers must be updated appropriately. This was meant
to be fixed by I86e9673ac409b3b3e881bea7cb8b3516f320388d, but that
change doesn't cope well with the new format of column names.

Closes-Bug: #1259915

Change-Id: Iec39c8804ea47307a98d1b79899ff74af9404bf6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/93/67093/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # 1 column - (IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: tbl.k1# N columns - (IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: tbl.k1, tbl.k2 columns = [c.split('.')[-1] for c in columns.strip().split(", ")]
deleted_lines: # 1 column - (IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: k1# N columns - (IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: k1, k2 columns = columns.strip().split(", ")

commit_message:
Make _change_index_columns use existing utility methods

The _change_index_columns method is doing a drop/add index operation and
since we have utility methods to do exactly that already, just re-use
them.

Change-Id: I5706c4512b1324aab64f70cd053c464d9a50e233
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/63180/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _drop_index(migrate_engine, table, index_name, old_columns) _add_index(migrate_engine, table, index_name, new_columns)
deleted_lines: if _index_exists(migrate_engine, table.name, index_name): Index( index_name, *[getattr(table.c, col) for col in old_columns] ).drop(migrate_engine) Index( index_name, *[getattr(table.c, col) for col in new_columns] ).create()

commit_message:
Add the plan objects and schema

In the interest of simplicity the plan gets stored as a Text blob.
We could change this in the future to split it out into a composite
object.

Change-Id: I96e01264f6a64556e94545d147b8229e65ae219f

commit_message:
Add API resources for Plans and Plan

Plans are used as a template for creating assemblies. This patch adds a
place to hang documentation for Plan and Plans resources.

Also see: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/solum-demystified

blueprint api
Change-Id: I56240f79ddbd49d69b9e62b7b2030863eeadf3c5
Co-Authored-By: Angus Salkeld <angus.salkeld@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/49/62549/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 - Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import pecan from pecan import rest import six import wsme from wsme import types as wtypes import wsmeext.pecan as wsme_pecan from solum.api.controllers.v1 import types as api_types from solum.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ class Plan(api_types.Base): """Representation of an Plan file. The Plan resource is a representation of a Plan file. Plans are used to create Assembly resources. A Plan resource may be used to create an arbitrary number of Assembly instances. They use artifacts and services to indicate what willbe used to generate the plan, and what services Solum can use to satisfy them. Note: Plan files ar YAML and Plan resources are the rest representation of the Plan file after services have been matched to ones offered by Solum. """ @classmethod def sample(cls): return cls(uri='http://example.com/v1/plans/x1', name='Example Plan', type='plan', tags=['small'], artifacts=[], services=[], camp_version='CAMP 1.1', origin='Solum', project_id='1dae5a09ef2b4d8cbf3594b0eb4f6b94', user_id='55f41cf46df74320b9486a35f5d28a11', description='A mysql database') class PlanController(rest.RestController): """Manages operations on a single plan.""" def __init__(self, plan_id): pecan.request.context['plan_id'] = plan_id self._id = plan_id @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(Plan, wtypes.text) def get(self): """Return this plan.""" error = _("Not implemented") pecan.response.translatable_error = error raise wsme.exc.ClientSideError(six.text_type(error)) @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(Plan, wtypes.text, body=Plan) def put(self, data): """Modify this plan.""" error = _("Not implemented") pecan.response.translatable_error = error raise wsme.exc.ClientSideError(six.text_type(error)) @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(None, wtypes.text, status_code=204) def delete(self): """Delete this plan.""" error = _("Not implemented") pecan.response.translatable_error = error raise wsme.exc.ClientSideError(six.text_type(error)) class PlansController(rest.RestController): """Manages operations on the plans collection.""" @pecan.expose() def _lookup(self, plan_id, *remainder): if remainder and not remainder[-1]: remainder = remainder[:-1] return PlanController(plan_id), remainder @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(Plan, body=Plan, status_code=201) def post(self, data): """Create a new plan.""" error = _("Not implemented") pecan.response.translatable_error = error raise wsme.exc.ClientSideError(six.text_type(error)) @wsme_pecan.wsexpose([Plan]) def get_all(self): """Return all plans, based on the query provided.""" return []

commit_message:
Clean swap_volume rollback, on libvirt exception.

Handling swap_volume command's rollback on the manager side
instead of the API, to allow clean rollback.

Change-Id: I7d5c1e66bf01fd12fcaa783c1c3c90d92b009aea
Closes-Bug: #1222656

commit_message:
Ignore any egg and egg-info directories

Running the tests installs pbr in a way that leaves a .egg directory in
the source tree, so update the ignore file to ignore it.

Change-Id: I7d702c9511992efc518195def0967bc0191d93a9

Update python-keystoneclient to 0.5.0

A new version of keystoneclient was released containing changes we
wish to use in Heat, so bump to the latest version.

commit_message:
Make change_instance_metadata() use objects

This patch makes the compute manager change_instance_metadata()
method take an instance object.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I4139ef8db87bb42cc05cbfb7cbe38aea27235f8b

commit_message:
Fix TCP/UDP usage for rsyslog logging

- Introduce 'both' value for rsyslog server proto
- Make rsyslog server to listen both tcp and udp
- Fix wrong proto param usage for clients (clients
  should use $rservers hash instead)
- Change base rsyslog server proto to TCP

CI retest
Additional to: #1271176
Closes bug: #1276065

Change-Id: I3b13781a85a88dcb7d36edb54f5ad60c2f16c74b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Enable corosync log to pacemaker.log locally

In order to collect HA logs locally as well to syslog,
use either corosync logfile option or custom rsyslog
template, but not both.

This patch enables custom rsyslog template for
pacemaker.log to avoid messages duplicating in daemon.log.

Closes bug: #1275127

Change-Id: I237414f38c312243ad51e5d14f6c6141b684f956
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Fix string-to-boolean casting in queries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 13:16:41.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_list_meters_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/65fefd101df73ccef61bd5550d6ea49d92b3da74', 'message': "Fix string-to-boolean casting in queries

There is a function that converts strings to boolean that uses the
following rule:
Strings-True ('1', 't', 'true', 'on', 'y', 'yes') are converted to True
Strings-False ('0', 'f', 'false', 'off', 'n', 'no') are converted to False

But there is a default value (False by default) that returned in case when
the string is not in any of lists above. So by default any string that is
not in Strings-True will be converted to False. We may change this behaviour
by using strict=True checking.

If user creates a query we should validate that only valid strings (as above)
or boolean True or False are used in case of boolean filter.

Relates to bug 1236496

Change-Id: I83a54f09d715269c2d356bb7979a0372e6f7d2d0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix string-to-boolean casting in queries

There is a function that converts strings to boolean that uses the
following rule:
Strings-True ('1', 't', 'true', 'on', 'y', 'yes') are converted to True
Strings-False ('0', 'f', 'false', 'off', 'n', 'no') are converted to False

But there is a default value (False by default) that returned in case when
the string is not in any of lists above. So by default any string that is
not in Strings-True will be converted to False. We may change this behaviour
by using strict=True checking.

If user creates a query we should validate that only valid strings (as above)
or boolean True or False are used in case of boolean filter.

Relates to bug 1236496

Change-Id: I83a54f09d715269c2d356bb7979a0372e6f7d2d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/62/71262/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
LBaaS: fix handling pending create/update members and health monitors

When agent requests loadbalancer logical config from server,
server returns only active pool members and health_monitors.
Need to make server return also members and monitors which are in pending states.

Also a small refactoring moving ACTIVE_PENDING set to common place

Change-Id: I8e10004f199f982b055da18ea7a0e5e4d11fa7fb
Closes-Bug: #1259965

commit_message:
Revert "Shelve: The snapshot should be removed when delete instance."

This reverts commit 48729259c570d73d7c35228718ecc4e9bb258e36.

The fingerprint for bug 1275256 started showing up around 1/28/14
and there are a lot of rechecks around that shelve-related patch
so it's probably the cause of the race condition.

Closes-Bug: #1275256

Change-Id: I76373af0e09555b99399127c1ad10346cce77f45

commit_message:
Added the content of the ceph Blueprint in the USECASES.md and linked it in the README.md

Change-Id: I05beac0478e1025407ebadf1b6cf91c5e77dcddf
Implements: I want to run benchmarks on three new machines
Closes-Bug: #1243332
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/45/71545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Use Cases ========= I want to try this module, heard of ceph, want to see it in action ------------------------------------------------------------------ _Notice : Please note that the code below is a sample which may not be up to date and is not expected to work._ I want to run it on my own laptop, all in one. The **ceph::conf** class will create configuration file with no authentication enabled, on my **localhost**. The **ceph::mon** resource configures and runs a monitor to which two **ceph::osd** daemon will connect to provide disk storage, using directories in **/srv** on the laptop. /node/ { class { 'ceph::conf': auth_enable => false, mon_host => 'localhost' } ceph::mon { $hostname: }; ceph::osd { '/srv/osd1': }; ceph::osd { '/srv/osd2': }; } * install puppet, * paste this in site.pp and replace /node/ with the name of your current node, * puppet apply site.pp, * type **ceph -s** : it will connect to the monitor and report that the cluster is **HEALTH_OK** I want to operate a production cluster --------------------------------------- _Notice : Please note that the code below is a sample which may not be up to date and is not expected to work._ $admin_key = 'AQCTg71RsNIHORAAW+O6FCMZWBjmVfMIPk3MhQ==' $mon_key = 'AQDesGZSsC7KJBAAw+W/Z4eGSQGAIbxWjxjvfw==' $boostrap_osd_key = 'AQABsWZSgEDmJhAAkAGSOOAJwrMHrM5Pz5On1A==' /ceph-default/ { ceph::conf{ mon_host => 'mon1.a.tld,mon2.a.tld.com,mon3.a.tld' }; } /mon[123]/ inherits ceph-default { ceph::mon{ $hostname: key => $mon_key } ceph::key{'client.admin': secret => $admin_key, caps_mon => '*', caps_osd => '*', inject => true, } cceph::key{'client.bootstrap-osd': secret => $bootstrap_osd_key, caps_mon => 'profile bootstrap-osd' inject => true, } } /osd*/ inherits ceph-default { ceph::osd{ 'discover' }; ceph::key{'client.bootstrap-osd': keyring => '/var/lib/ceph/bootstrap-osd/ceph.keyring', secret => $bootstrap_osd_key, } } /client/ inherits ceph-default { ceph::key{'client.admin': keyring => '/etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring', secret => $admin_key } ceph::client{ }; } * the *osd* nodes only contain disks that are used for OSD and using the discover option to automatically use new disks and provision them as part of the cluster is acceptable, there is no risk of destroying unrelated data. * when a hardware is decomissioned, all its disks can be placed in another machines and the OSDs will automatically be re-inserted in the cluster, even if an external journal is used I want to run benchmarks on three new machines ----------------------------------------------- There are four machines, 3 OSD, 1 MON and one machine that is the client from which the user runs commands. install puppetmaster and create site.pp with: /ceph-default/ { class { 'ceph::conf': auth_enable => false, mon_host => 'node1' }; } /node1/ inherits ceph-default { ceph::mon { $hostname: }; ceph::osd { 'discover': }; } /node2/, /node3/ inherits ceph-default { ceph::osd { 'discover': }; } /client/ inherits ceph-default { class { 'ceph::client' }; } * ssh client * rados bench * interpret the results

commit_message:
Add benchmark tests for glance

The patch adds the following benchmark tests for glance:
* Add and delete image
* Boot the several instances from added image

Also some changes are added related with using
fake Glance client the for following unit tests:
* test_generic_cleanup in tests/benchmark/test_runner.py
* test_snapshot_server in tests/benchmark/scenarios/nova/test_servers.py

Implements: blueprint benchmark-scenarios
Change-Id: I31471a91455bd20eea000a66c59320178455cb50

commit_message:
Change CORS headers to be assigned to containers

Copy content from
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/cors.html
to replace misleading content in
http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-object-storage/1.0/
content/assigning-cors-headers-to-requests.html

Change ">" to ">" in example

Use $publicURL to represent the endpoint which includes
the API version number and the account/tenantID.

Closes-Bug: #1260840

Change-Id: I9dfe46d610bfcf2f9646cb28a4246954c180252d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/object-api refs/changes/10/70910/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
>www.w3.org/TR/access-control/.
Supported Headers
Metadata Use
X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin Origins to be allowed to make Cross Origin Requests, space separated.
X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Max-Age Max age for the Origin to hold the preflight results.
X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Expose-Headers Headers exposed to the user agent (e.g. browser) in the the actual request response. Space separated.
CORS metadata is held on the container only. The values given apply to the container itself and all objects within it. You can find more details in the Swift Documentation.
deleted_lines: >www.w3.org/TR/access-control/</link>.<itemizedlist> <listitem> <para>Access-Control-Allow-Credentials</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Access-Control-Allow-Methods</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Access-Control-Allow-Origin</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Access-Control-Expose-Headers</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Access-Control-Max-Age</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Access-Control-Request-Headers</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Access-Control-Request-Method</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Origin</para> </listitem> </itemizedlist></para> <para>You can assign these headers to objects only.</para>

subject: Create heat database with default character set utf-8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-06 01:48:47.000000000', 'files': ['bin/heat-db-setup'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/84e1942f0b53ff3be651f290f11879ddabac4b76', 'message': "Create heat database with default character set utf-8

The heat-db-setup script wasn't creating the heat database with default
character set utf-8 which can cause the migrations to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1276880

Change-Id: I35861af66d70314285fa76bb148e403aeea4b654
"}]
commit_message:
Create heat database with default character set utf-8

The heat-db-setup script wasn't creating the heat database with default
character set utf-8 which can cause the migrations to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1276880

Change-Id: I35861af66d70314285fa76bb148e403aeea4b654
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/37/71437/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS heat DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8;
deleted_lines: CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS heat;

subject: Remove unnecessary volume creation in test_server_rescue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-27 20:04:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/b4753f7606ed327fa6a2642792e1306d5f3d06bb', 'message': "Fix volume creation race condition in test_server_rescue tests

The setup in test_server_rescue is creating two volumes that are only
used in specific test cases so (1) they aren't needed in the class setup
for all tests and (2) on tear down they are deleted but the code doesn't
wait for them to be gone before moving on.

When running these tests in parallel we're seeing a race where we
timeout waiting for the volume creation, presumably because Cinder is
still working on creates/deletes for the potentially unnecessary volumes
from other concurrent tests.

This patch moves the volume create/delete in the specific test cases
that need them, uses the common base class code to delete the volume and
wait for it to be gone, and also moves the _delete_volume method from
the v2 compute base test class into it's parent so the v3 compute base
test case can also use it with it's own volumes client.

Closes-Bug: #1254772

Change-Id: Id98f65cc2843a97221222e86c60b3859e15af869
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-27 20:38:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4e4b5a03dddff626aa5f34318292b7c883deee0c', 'message': "Fix volume creation race condition in test_server_rescue tests

used in specific test cases so (1) they aren't needed in the class setup
for all tests and (2) on tear down they are deleted but the code doesn't
wait for them to be gone before moving on.

When running these tests in parallel we're seeing a race where we
timeout waiting for the volume creation, presumably because Cinder is
still working on creates/deletes for the potentially unnecessary volumes
from other concurrent tests.

This patch moves the volume create/delete into the specific test cases
that need them, uses the common base class code to delete the volume and
wait for it to be gone, and also moves the _delete_volume method from
the v2 compute base test class into it's parent so the v3 compute base
test case can also use it with it's own volumes client.

Closes-Bug: #1254772

Change-Id: Id98f65cc2843a97221222e86c60b3859e15af869

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary volume creation in test_server_rescue

The setup in test_server_rescue is creating two volumes where really
only one shared volume is necessary, so remove the second volume. This
patch also uses the common base class code to wait for the volume
deletion on tear down and makes the volume name random within the
context of the class name for easier debugging.

This patch moves the volume create/delete into the specific test cases
that need them, uses the common base class code to delete the volume and
wait for it to be gone, and also moves the _delete_volume method from
the v2 compute base test class into it's parent so the v3 compute base
test case can also use it with it's own volumes client.

Partial-Bug: #1254772

Change-Id: Id98f65cc2843a97221222e86c60b3859e15af869

commit_message:
Expunge session contents between plugin requests

In the NVP plugin, metadata processing performs several plugin operations
with the same context (and db session). The first operation might leave
persisted objects in the session instance which then conflict with objects
created in the second operation.

Closes-Bug: #1266482

Change-Id: Ic9e2b952013610647aa222f1a8b6e33504b54b37

commit_message:
Fix event_type names for stack CRUD notifications

According to the documentation [1] and for consistency, notifications
sent by Heat for stack CRUD operations must be :
orchestration.stack.{create,update,delete,suspend,resume}.{start,error,end}

Currently the notifications sent looks like (missing 'stack.')
orchestration.{create,update,delete,suspend,resume}.{start,error,end}

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SystemUsageData

Fixes bug #1273240

Change-Id: Id46158c495f10436b62755deaf5b6a91e2e7e4bc

deleted_lines: event_type = '%s.%s' % (stack.action.lower(), suffix)

Fix case error in qpid exchange type "direct"

Original-bug: #1211338

Most places correctly have "direct", but one place has "Direct"
instead, which is incorrect.

(cherry picked from commit bec54ac5fb6a190c98079537f63d2f0e17584d21)

Change-Id: I4681f04534bc27b2571774766d34121b37ebcf45

commit_message:
A cloud-config resource based on SoftwareConfig

This simple resource allows cloud-config to be specified
as a map property, and stores the resulting YAML as a SoftwareConfig
resource.

Because cloud-init is boot only, this resource won't be used with
a SoftwareDeployment resource, also it will not have inputs or outputs.

Instead, a server's user_data can contain this resource via get_resource
when user_data_format is SOFTWARE_CONFIG.

Implements: blueprint cloud-init-resource

Change-Id: I15c8d6a03b8da274531b76cca658e37def4eb460

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat.common.template_format import yaml from heat.common.template_format import yaml_dumper from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine.resources.software_config import software_config class CloudConfig(software_config.SoftwareConfig): PROPERTIES = ( CLOUD_CONFIG ) = ( 'cloud_config' ) properties_schema = { CLOUD_CONFIG: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, _('Map representing the cloud-config data structure which will ' 'be formatted as YAML') ) } def handle_create(self): props = {self.NAME: self.physical_resource_name()} cloud_config = yaml.dump(self.properties.get( self.CLOUD_CONFIG), Dumper=yaml_dumper) props[self.CONFIG] = '#cloud-config\n%s' % cloud_config sc = self.heat().software_configs.create(**props) self.resource_id_set(sc.id) def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Heat::CloudConfig': CloudConfig, }

commit_message:
Add keystone_authtoken.enforce_token_bind boilerplate

Add boilerplate for the following config option:

  [keystone_authtoken]
  enforce_token_bind

in the ceilometer.conf.sample.

Change-Id: I4860ec3774385cc98c2600eb1449d356bc63b408

added_lines: # Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be # set to: "disabled" to not check token binding. "permissive" # (default) to validate binding information if the bind type # is of a form known to the server and ignore it if not. # "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind type is unknown # the token will be rejected. "required" any form of token # binding is needed to be allowed. Finally the name of a # binding method that must be present in tokens. (string # value) #enforce_token_bind=permissive

commit_message:
Ensure stack lock is released after stack-delete

Previously, stack locks would not be released after a stack-delete
because the stack ID was being passed to db_api.stack_lock_release() as
None.  To resolve this, pass the stack ID to the greenthread-linked
release function while it still exists.

Change-Id: I260c4c5512bd2069f134e9d6ac6ea07565e443b0
Closes-Bug: #1276336
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/90/71390/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: lock.release() th.link(release) lock.release()

commit_message:
Verify setenforce is executable

Some images/distros do not install/use selinux. This small change will
verify that `setenforce` is executable and in the path before attempting
to run the command. This prevents the script from erroring and causing a
failed `cloud-init` run.

Change-Id: I42f802c7994b8d907f0cc4e3b1a38e6fd89dac0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/19/71019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command -v setenforce >/dev/null 2>&1 && setenforce 0
deleted_lines: setenforce 0

subject: Call super class after extension check in vpnaas api test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 06:13:32.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_vpnaas_extensions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/a9c653729b5d4cf1f2bf38ff1a55fcbfb51f5003', 'message': 'Call super class after extension check in vpnaas api test

This commit fixes a bug in test_vpnaas_extensions.py. If the extension
is disabled then the tenant isolation code is called generating a new
tenant and the resources needed to use it in this test. However, since
the skip exception is raised after the super() call the tearDownClass
will not be run. This will cause the resources created by tenant
isolation to never get deleted. This commit fixes this behavior by
moving the skip before the super call.

Change-Id: Id7915978e7a42f641ff99493cb3918424dd98674
Closes-Bug: #1268852
'}]
commit_message:
Call super class after extension check in vpnaas api test

This commit fixes a bug in test_vpnaas_extensions.py. If the extension
is disabled then the tenant isolation code is called generating a new
tenant and the resources needed to use it in this test. However, since
the skip exception is raised after the super() call the tearDownClass
will not be run. This will cause the resources created by tenant
isolation to never get deleted. This commit fixes this behavior by
moving the skip before the super call.

Change-Id: Id7915978e7a42f641ff99493cb3918424dd98674
Closes-Bug: #1268852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/61/68561/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: super(VPNaaSJSON, cls).setUpClass()
deleted_lines: super(VPNaaSJSON, cls).setUpClass()

commit_message:
VMware: fix image snapshot with attached volume

A snapshot of a instance with an attached volume will result in
the wrong volume being uploaded to glance. The reason for this
are as follows:
1. the last image in the list of images would be exported
2. the base image would not be exported but the first found

The same happens with a VM rescue if there is a cinder volume
attached.

The solution is to search for an image that contains the instance
UUID.

Change-Id: Ic85b0ffd4f1c34f10d07b1a198eaad2030803d6f
Closes-bug: #1243193
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/48/53648/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: vmdk_file_path = device.backing.fileName vmdk_controller_key = device.controllerKey if getattr(device.backing, 'thinProvisioned', False): disk_type = "thin" else: if getattr(device.backing, 'eagerlyScrub', False): disk_type = "eagerZeroedThick" else: disk_type = "preallocated"

commit_message:
Add log info for tempest SSH connection issues

The patch does the following:
1. Add in extra information
2. Logs current attempts
3. Waits a little longer prior to the next SSH attempt

Related-bug: #1253896

Change-Id: I878362899b4cf81143c02c15c55936b33cf65ec8

commit_message:
vmdk: To add missing time unit in driver option

Time unit is missing in the description of vmdk driver option
"vmware_task_poll_interval". Due to this, the vmdk driver config
reference document doesn't have the timeunit in its description
column. This fix adds the missing time unit (seconds) in the
driver option.

Closes-Bug: #1258100
Change-Id: I2c49c65ca9a48a2dcc6898a32b4bbc0433e8916b

commit_message:
Define common "name" parameter for Nova v3 API

Nova v3 API contains 'name' parameters such as aggregate, backup,
flavor, keypair and server. The validation way of each parameter
is different like the following because of just porting it from v2
APIs:

  Resource  | Length  | Pattern
 -----------+---------+----------------------------------
  aggregate | 1-255   | nothing
  backup    | nothing | nothing
  flavor    | 1-255   | '^[a-zA-Z0-9. _-]*[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+
            |         |   [a-zA-Z0-9. _-]*$'
  keypair   | 1-255   | '^[a-zA-Z0-9 _-]+$'
  server    | 1-255   | nothing

All of them are stored in the DB, and it would make APIs consistent if
applying the same validation way to all APIs.

This patch adds the validation way for all 'name' parameters.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: I05391a03f383cac1d475cd4266cf7f5ced664f9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/67781/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name = { # NOTE: Nova v3 API contains some 'name' parameters such # as keypair, server, flavor, aggregate and so on. They are # stored in the DB and Nova specific parameters. # This definition is used for all their parameters. 'type': 'string', 'minLength': 1, 'maxLength': 255, # NOTE: Allow to some spaces in middle of name. 'allOf': [ {'pattern': '^[a-zA-Z0-9._-]+[a-zA-Z0-9. _-]*$'}, {'pattern': '^[a-zA-Z0-9. _-]*[a-zA-Z0-9._-]+$'}, ], }

commit_message:
Skip negative tests of v3 server metadata

If sending long metadata to "create a server" API of Nova v3 API,
the API returns an OverLimit response now.

However the commit Ic17d2227909c9180ca86c9d578dad4c73ec57dfc will
change the response to BadRequest. To verify the commit on Jenkins,
it is necessary to skip the tests related to long metadata temporary.

Change-Id: Ic03c2247505780fbeda68e908298a98862ea0c7c
Related-Bug: #1273948
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/93/69793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.assertRaises(exceptions.OverLimit,

commit_message:
Removing duplicated classes from lbaas.py and vpn.py

This patch removes duplicated classes AttributeDict from
api/lbaas.py and api/vpn.py. Additional attributes are
added as needed in 'list' and 'get' methods.

Closes-Bug: #1267779
Change-Id: I47d8eb5fc9bd0767ac85a7c65d394ab2b7a2ea5d

commit_message:
Add create volume from volume

Cinder has the ability to create volumes as copy of a volume,
we should offer that as option via horizon, too.

This change also fixes bug 1272169

Change-Id: Idbded6ecd49ff097c063873352405ae2bd91715e
Implements: blueprint create-volume-from-volume

commit_message:
Standardize Data types accross model objects

Following the discussion on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69601/
this patch standardize the data types of resources for the model
objects. Link have to be replaced by URI.

In the component model, nested components are represented as a list
of IDs that can then be queried individually. The attribute
abreviated has been added to specify if the component has nested
components at more than one level depth

Change-Id: I58c8f95fb4fb170efb071b81d76bfe8012ad050a

commit_message:
Unpin kazoo

There doesn't seem to be a reason to pin to a
year old version of kazoo since other projects
would like to use the newer version its safer
just to unpin the version restriction.

Change-Id: I7c5a74e06f604ce89f0de0a4b01a8f7be41d70a2

commit_message:
Add -m memory option to setup-seed-vm

Add an option to increase the memory of the seed VM.

Defaults to 2G (same as configure-vm).

I've seen the seed VM run out of memory when provisioning
some underclouds... this should help in those cases.

Change-Id: I559ac235d8e4811f0ac44b545a69b90f0797bbad

commit_message:
Make sure report_interval is less than service_down_time

If service_down_time is less than report_interval, services will
routinely be considered down, because they report in too rarely.
Add check for service_down_time vs report_interval, if report_interval
is larger than service_down_time, automatically change
service_down_time to be report_interval * 2.5

DocImpact

Closes bug #1255685

Change-Id: I1be42e1826142b8f3f2c39f3734bef713a12a693

commit_message:
Make sure the alembic schema are run in the tests

We need to make sure that the migrations are run to get
the latest schema when the db is created in the new Database
fixture.

Note: alembic migrations do not seem to work with an in-memory sqlite
as the alembic command is run in a different process
resulting in no schema been applied.

Now we use a new sqlite database (tempfile) for each test and make use of the
NestedTempfile fixture to delete the file.

Change-Id: Iea7f5c90e91404a89bdd526f609f4352c7f5dbd3

under MySQL. By default MySQL truncates inserted string if it longer

commit_message:
Enable mysql_traditional_mode

This is required to prevent silent truncates at insert or update operations
under MySQL. By default MySQL truncates inserted string if it longer
than a declared field just with warning. That is fraught with data
corruption.

Change-Id: I5007cac3501d50b9876d87f9f662e6e7dde03cb1

commit_message:
Add IDH plugin

This patch was created because when applies patches not created new files.

Change-Id: I2e1c88c367edc406faed0a1a980471cfcd822828
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/07/71507/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Intel Corporation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from savanna import context from savanna.openstack.common import log as logging from savanna.plugins.intel import exceptions as iex LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def get(ctx, session_id): url = '/cluster/%s/session/%s' % (ctx.cluster_name, session_id) return ctx.rest.get(url) def wait(ctx, session_id): #TODO(lazarev) add check on savanna cluster state (exit on delete) #TODO(alazarev) make configurable (bug #1262897) timeout = 4*60*60 # 4 hours cur_time = 0 while cur_time < timeout: info_items = get(ctx, session_id)['items'] for item in info_items: progress = item['nodeprogress'] if progress['info'].strip() == '_ALLFINISH': return else: context.sleep(10) cur_time += 10 debug_msg = 'Hostname: %s\nInfo: %s' debug_msg = debug_msg % (progress['hostname'], progress['info']) LOG.debug(debug_msg) else: raise iex.IntelPluginException( "Cluster '%s' has failed to start in %s minutes" % (ctx.cluster_name, timeout / 60))

subject: Refactored unit tests structure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-30 20:16:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/8c6255c7de05b17a1782ba778671f008c2f2c73c', 'message': 'Introduced override_config utility method for unit tests

Change-Id: I429f43df30bf12e6801a6c8f1bf00d9b09c8d15c
Closes-Bug: #1273457
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-01 00:00:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/2e8055bf0d6577bc9cf8231282118cae2b4fe05b', 'message': "Refactored unit tests structure

Renamed DbTestCase to SavannaTestCase. This base class now
  * sets up db for the test
  * sets up context for the test
  * provides utility methods like 'override_config'

Probably it is good idea to move everything from testutils to this class.

Closes-Bug: #1273457

Change-Id: I429f43df30bf12e6801a6c8f1bf00d9b09c8d15c
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-03 22:36:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/9e6b3f31f17c05272e3e4dce6c4c9e035d9991ad', 'message': 'Refactored unit tests structure

Created SavannaTestCase class with utility methods. It allows to:
  * set up db for the test
  * set up context for the test
  * override savanna config for the test

Created SavannaWithDbTestCase that sets up context and db automatically in setUp. It replaces old DbTestCase.

Probably it is good idea to move everything from testutils to SavannaTestCase.

Closes-Bug: #1273457

Change-Id: I429f43df30bf12e6801a6c8f1bf00d9b09c8d15c
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-04 15:43:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/d7b8b717c75685e587086cf5a486d72594b2e038', 'message': 'Refactored unit tests structure

Created SavannaTestCase class with utility methods. It allows to:
  * set up db for the test
  * set up context for the test
  * override savanna config for the test

Created SavannaWithDbTestCase that sets up db automatically in setUp. It replaces old DbTestCase.

Probably it is good idea to move everything from testutils to SavannaTestCase.

commit_message:
Refactored unit tests structure

Created SavannaTestCase class with utility methods. It allows to:
  * set up context for the test (set up automatically in setUp, can be overwritten)
  * override savanna config for the test

Created SavannaWithDbTestCase that sets up db automatically in setUp. It replaces old DbTestCase.

Closes-Bug: #1273457

Change-Id: I429f43df30bf12e6801a6c8f1bf00d9b09c8d15c

commit_message:
Fix Tempest tests failing on gate-solum-devstack-dsvm

Due to a new commit on tempest, devstack tests are failing. It changed
the signature of RestClient constructor.

This patch changes the signature of our inherited class to match the
change from tempest.

Change-Id: Id15682c68de123c0d66c6aa10d889c6304fcbb65

commit_message:
Fix urllib2 compatibility in test

In test we can't use six.moves.urllib.request as parameter of
stubs.Set, we need stubs real module.

Part of blueprint keystone-py3kcompat

Change-Id: I715f22bd97f26704cb054d21c3ba9ffd504867f5

commit_message:
Add hacking test to block cross-virt driver code usage

The baremetal driver has been accessing some libvirt driver
private classes and config variables. Any code that is intended
to be shared across virt drivers should be in a common package
instead. Add a hacking file to enforce this for imports and
config options so that no further problems like this are made
in the future.

NB, this skips verification of the baremetal driver until
bugs 1261826 and 1261827 are fixed, or the baremetal driver is
removed, whichever comes first.

Change-Id: Ifbfe597795795a847830f9bd937dc459cd37d118
Closes-Bug: #1261842

commit_message:
Allow spaces in host names in the storwize driver

Storwize/SVC naming rules allow host objects to have spaces in their
names. The SSH injection filter will currently reject such names, and so
we surround the names with quotes. Please note that this doesn't allow
to have an arbitrary character in there except a space (anything else
will be cleaned up by the driver or rejected by the SSH injection filter
up the call chain).

Change-Id: If9aec40fe34293031f08d759dd930d73ead456f5
Closes-Bug: #1270204

commit_message:
Enable accepting short mac for node ids

 This fix makes possible to select nodes with short macs.
 e.g: fuel --env 1 node --node 6h:67,13:d3,7 --list
 Also added new method to tests, and expanded existing
 node tests to check for mac selects.

 Node data validation also implemented.

 Closes-Bug: #1273092

Change-Id: I1aaab3e24ef772d309c7832da0c55c583470893a

added_lines: class NodeAction(argparse.Action): """Custom argparse.Action subclass to store distinct values :returns: Set of arguments """ def __call__(self, _parser, namespace, values, option_string=None): if not values: return None node_identitites = set(chain(*values)) input_macs = set(n for n in node_identitites if ":" in n) only_ids = set(map(int, node_identitites - input_macs)) if input_macs: nodes_mac_to_id_map = {n["mac"]: n["id"] for n in json_api_get_request("nodes/")} for short_mac in input_macs: target_node = [mac for mac in nodes_mac_to_id_map if mac.endswith(short_mac)] if target_node: only_ids.add(nodes_mac_to_id_map[target_node[0]]) else: print_error( 'Node with mac endfix "{0}" was not found.' .format(short_mac) ) setattr(namespace, self.dest, list(only_ids)) node_ids = params.node node_ids = map(str, node_ids) facts_default_url += "/?nodes=" + ",".join(map(str, params.node)) return map(lambda x: int(x) if ":" not in x else x, filtered) "action": NodeAction, "type": lambda v: v.split(","),
deleted_lines: node_ids = list(chain(*params.node)) else: node_ids = list(chain(*params.node)) node_ids = list(chain(*params.node)) node_ids = [str(n) for n in chain(*params.node)] node_ids = list(chain(*params.node)) facts_default_url += "/?nodes=" + ",".join( str(n) for n in chain(*params.node) ) return map(int, filtered) "action": "store", "type": parse_ids,

commit_message:
Adding floating ip pool to node groups details for cluster

Adding display of floating_ip_pool to the node groups tab
on the cluster details page.  It will only show up if
the floating_ip_pool is non-null.

Fixes:  bug #1257284

Change-Id: I96db789f64b0a32f186c61d0ddfb90a41412fd26
